Yaqub has a few sheep. He buys little lambs, raises them and sells them in the local bazaar to earn money. He has been in this business for 15 years. Also, he periodically sells sheep wool. Today Yaqub needs 900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat), and for this reason he applied to the Kiva partner, Komak,  for a loan. He is planning to buy supplies for the winter and wants to buy enough hay for the sheep, get vaccinations for them and so on.

He is thankful to Kiva and Komak for their help. In the future he wants to build a big stall.

loans.use: to buy enough hay for the sheep, get vaccinations for them and so on.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Dios proveerá está conformado por diez integrantes, madres solteras con doce hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Malpaisillo se caracteriza por su artesanía, y su comida típica como los quesillos. Estas mujeres han demostrado ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación persona, que luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Ya que  lamentablemente ellas no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.

Gracia a sus esfuerzos y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal es Mayra y tiene por actividad el servicio de transporte particular con un microbús el cual realiza viajes a diferentes ciudades y trabaja con  clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en el mantenimiento del vehículo como engrasado cambio de aceite, compra llantas. Para brindarles un mejor servicio a su clientela. El banco comunal Dios proveerá agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Dios Proveerá communal bank is comprised of ten members.  They are single mothers with 12 children who are their responsibility.  They are from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern part of the country.  Malpaisillo is known for its handicrafts and its typical food like “quesillos”.

These women have shown themselves to be hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement.  They struggle day to day in order to provide their children with a better future.  Sadly, they were not able to go to school due to the lack of financial resources.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Mayra is the coordinator of the communal bank.  She provides private transportation service with a micro-bus.  She makes trips to different cities, and she works with fixed and casual customers.  She spends ten hours a day on her business.

The loan is to pay for vehicle maintenance like lubrication, oil change, and buying tires.  She will do this in order to provide her clientele with better service.

The Dios Proveerá communal bank is grateful to the Kiva lenders who provide people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua with the means to have decent work.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance like lubrication, oil change, and buying tires.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 40 years old and lives in Montserrado county, which has the largest freeport, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has four children who are in school and live at home.

For the past 17 years, she has been selling oil at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She spends 9 hours each day on her business, and she is good at managing it.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children. She appreciates the supporter of BRAC and promises to payback her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Binta is 35 years old and lives in Montserrado county, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children, ages 3 and 12 years old who are attending school and living at home. 

She has been selling palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. for the past three years. She says her main challenges are transportation costs. She started this business with money given to her by her father, and she learned this business from her friends.

Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money, and what make her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house for her children in future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is an experienced farmer from Goris city in the Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, son, and school-aged daughter. He works as a driver in the private sector. However, his salary alone is not enough to cover his family's daily expenses. With the help of his wife, Armen is engaged in cattle breeding and in breeding a livestock of piglets. As life is getting more expensive with time, Armen wants to enlarge the livestock to be able to take care of his family more effectively. A loan USD 3,000 USD will assist him greatly, enabling him to purchase ten pigs, two heifers, and some forage for his livestock. Armen and his family members highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase ten pigs, two heifers, and some forage for his livestock.

loans.name: Majdoleen

texts.en:
Majdoleen was born in 1974. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat, with her husband and four children. Her husband has a clothes store. 

Majdoleen also sells clothes at her house for three years now. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. She considered her work a good source of income to help her husband in improving their living conditions and in covering their children's needs. 

Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, es una joven de familia está casada, tiene 29 años, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, uno de sus hijos ya inicio la escuela. Desde hace 10 años trabaja todos los días en la venta de tortillas y crianza de pollos, con esté negocio genera los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa.
Comprará maíz, leña, pollos y concentrado para alimentarlos, está inversión le permitirá a Esmeralda tener los insumos necesarios para que su negocio aumente la productividad y sus ganancias mejoren. 
Sueña con brindar a sus hijos una buena alimentación, mejor salud, educación de calidad, mejorar su economía para cancelar las cuotas y seguir invirtiendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a young, married girl with a family and is 29-years-old. She lives with her two children and husband. One of her children already started school.  

For 10 years, she has been working every day selling tortillas and raising chickens. With this business, she generates the necessary income to support her husband with the household expenses.

She will buy corn, firewood, chickens, and chicken feed. This investment will allow Esmeralda to have the supplies needed so that her business will increase productivity and raise profits.

She dreams of providing her children good nutrition, better health, quality education, and improve her economic situation by paying off her loan and investing in the business.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, chickens, and chicken feed

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es:
Rosa de 51 años,  estudio hasta tercer grado de educación, es viuda hace 13 años y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno esta con ella y un nieto.  


Ella tiene 32 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, desde muy joven el padre de ella le enseñó esta actividad, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad para ayudar a su familia, ella tiene otra actividad económica la de un trabajo de medio tiempo cuidando un niño, en una casa; su trabajo está a 2 kilómetros.
 

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  abono, fertilizantes, herbicida para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. El préstamo mejorara la producción de maíz, porque se fertilizara en buen tiempo esto ayudara a que le generara más ingresos con la venta de los granos  


El sueño para su negocio, es poder producir una mejor cosecha para asegurar la alimentación de su familia, espero para su familia que logren las metas con trabajo y esfuerzo.  El préstamo le ayudara a fertilizar a tiempo la agricultura, la utilizara en la siembra de más granos básicos, para la otra temporada y cultivar otros productos como hortalizas, verduras, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 51, went up to third grade in school. She has been a widow for 13 years and has four children. Only one of her children, and one grandson, live with her.
She has worked in agriculture for 32 years. When she was very young her father taught her this work. She decided to farm for a living in order to help her family. She also takes care of a child part time for a salary; she goes to the child's home, which is two kilometres away.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of manure, fertilizer, and herbicides for cultivating corn and beans. This loan will improve her corn production because she will be able to fertilize it on time. This will help her to generate more income with the sale of her produce.
Her dream for her business is to be able to produce a better harvest in order to secure her family's food. She hopes for their sake that she will reach her goals through hard work. This loan will help her to fertilize on time. She will use it to plant basic staples and cultivate crops such as vegetables.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and herbicide, and for cultivating corn and beans.

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Group Dios Verdadero 1, 2 & 3 (True God). This group is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Juana sells silver and gold jewelry. This is the 13th loan she has requested from Esperanza; with it she is planning to purchase more jewelry and clothes to expand her business inventory. 

She is very excited about these loans. They made it possible for her to start a business almost seven years ago, and she is still running it today. She continues to expand her sales into more products and clients. Juana tells us that her challenge is to have a sustainable business, to be able to provide for her four children, and to help her long-term partner with extra income. Her business profits will be used to reinvest in her business. 

She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and clothing

loans.name: Mirtala

texts.es:
Mirtala, sigue trabajando por ampliar su negocio y en esta ocasión invertirá en compra de carne, aceite, tortillas, gas y también reparara su coche para vender tacos. Con el crédito anterior logro reunir la cantidad necesaria para adquirir un coche y salir a vender tacos por su zona residencial, su economía ha mejorado mucho, sus ventas han aumentado.
Ha enseñado su oficio a su esposo, se encuentra muy saludable y con mucho positivismo para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Mirtala continues working to expand her business. At this time, she will purchase meat, oil, tortillas, and gas as well as repair the vehicle she uses to sell tacos.  With the previous loan, she raised the funds needed to purchase a car and go out selling tacos in her neighborhood.  Her finances have greatly improved and her sales have increased.  She has taught the trade to her husband and she feels very healthy and very positive about continuing to work.

loans.use: to purchase meat, oil, tortillas, and gas.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 31 years old and lives Montserrado county, which is the largest Freeport and the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with five children between 8 and 20 years old, and are in school and live at home. 

She has been operating a shop where she sells bread and tea for the past 8 years now. She started this business with help from her boyfriend, and she learned this business from her mother. 

Her favorite part about her business is the profit she makes every day, and she has more customers. She is requesting this loan to purchase more sugar, Lipton's tea, milk, bread, etc. for her business. she appreciates the supporter of BRAC, and she promise to payback her loan on time.
In future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, Lipton's tea, milk, bread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet Marie. She is 28 years old from Jui, eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 2 children. In 2005, Marie established her Palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Abdifatah Jama

texts.en: Abdifatah Jama is 22 years old. He studies at Alpha University College with the faculty of Accounting. He faces a major problem in his learning. His problem is the lack of a laptop to learn. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. He cannot pay the money all at one time. He approached Kaaba MFI, and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. After his time in the university, Abdifatah hopes to prepare for his master's degree in accounting.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Nour Awil

texts.en: Nour Awil is a 24-year-old. He studies Information Technology at the University of Hargeisa. His problem is that he has no laptop, and it’s difficult for him to have practical practices. He has informed Kaaba-Kiva that he would like to have a laptop loan. He approached Kaaba MFI, and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Abdiqani Ismacil

texts.en: Abdiqani Ismacil is 21 years old. He studies at Gollis University, faculty of Telecommunication Engineering. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and to read lessons when given in soft copy. Buying a laptop on his own is the most challenging thing he has faced in his learning process. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students the soft copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide, which he will pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Abdilahi Mahdi

texts.en: Abdilahi Mahdi is 20 years old. He finished his secondary school and he also finished Shifo Nursing School. He wanted to start at the University as soon as he finished secondary school. He needs a laptop and he requested a laptop as a loan from Kaaba, which he will pay for in installments. Now he is waiting for the laptop. Abdilahi wants to learn medicine, and after university he hopes to become a doctor.

loans.use: To buy a  laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Hassan Ismacil

texts.en: Hassan Ismacil is 28 years old. He finished his secondary school. He wanted to start at the university as soon as he finished his secondary school. He needs a laptop and he cannot pay the money all at one time. He requested a laptop as a loan from Kaaba, which he will pay for in installments. Now he is waiting for the laptop.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Entisar

texts.en:
Because Entisar is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. 

Entisar was born in 1973. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Baqaa, with her husband and her three children. Her husband is a retired man who currently works as a newspaper man. 

One of Entisar's daughters is studying for a Bachelor of Nursing. She is in her last year and is planning to work in her study field after graduation in order to start supporting her family financially. 

She has only one step to go before reaching her goal. But Entisar doesn't have enough money to pay her daughter's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
Haifa was born in 1964. She lives in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Salt, with her husband and their daughter. Her husband is a painter, and she has a retired brother. 

Haifa has been selling clothes for three years now. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. She considered her work a good source of income to support her husband in covering their child's needs. 

Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes and to add variety to them to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business with added variety

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Because Fatima is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. 

Fatima was born in 1970. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt, with her husband and her six children. Her husband is a nurse. 

One of Fatima's sons is studying for a Bachelor of Medicine. He is in his first year and he is planning to work in his study field after graduation in order to start financially supporting his family. 

But, Fatima doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a 26-year-old university student who lives in the West point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. 

Roseline has been selling slippers for the past four years and she is a very successful business woman. One thing she enjoys about her business is that it helps her to generate more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business

loans.name: Amina Muse

texts.en: Amina Muse is 29 years old. She has four children. She finished Adisababa medical college with the faculty of medicine. She is in charge of Sheikh TB Center. Her main challenge is the lack of a laptop to report the activities of the center. She approached Kaaba Microfinance Institution for a laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop to Amina as a loan, and she will make monthly repayments

loans.use: To buy a laptop for work purposes.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 19 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid, with her three siblings and her parents. Her father is a retired man who currently works as a driver. 

Amal is studying for a Bachelor of Persian Language degree. She is in her second year. She is planning to continue her study in order to find a good job in her study field after graduation, to start financially helping her parents since they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay Amal's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Barot

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Барот. Ему 56 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более 15 лет занимается земледелием и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Он в основном выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу, морковь и т.п. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Однако он не имеет денег, чтобы купить семена и минеральные удобрения для осеннего посева.  Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A good man, who always tries to improve his living conditions, and hopes for a bright future, is in need of financial support. His name is Barot. He is 56 years old. He has a wife and four children to educate. Since he lives in a rural area, he has a good opportunity to grow his business breeding cattle. He has spent more than 15 years working in agriculture and has lots of experience in this sector of business. He basically grows wheat, corn, carrots, etc. He wants to develop his business and collect a larger income. However, he doesn't have enough money to buy seed and mineral fertilizer for autumn sowing. He is requesting a sum of 2000 Somoni to purchase seed and mineral fertilizer. With the income he receives he plans to improve his living conditions. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single and has a three-month-old child. She is a high school dropout and she describes herself as a very hard working woman.  For the past six years, she has been operating a table where she sells rice, charcoal, oil etc around the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her fiance. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week from 7 am to 5 pm and most of the time she uses the bus to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventories such as rice, charcoal, oil etc for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her child in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell such as rice, charcoal, oil etc

loans.name: Jerline N.

texts.en: Jerline N is 35 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single and has two children aged 5 and 17 who live at home and attend school. She did not go to school, but she manages her business well.  For the past six years, she has been operating a shop where she plaits and dresses hair around the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She works six days a week from 7 am to 5 pm. She is requesting a loan to purchase more grease, artificial-hair, hair relaxer, etc for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more grease, artificial-hair, hair-relaxer, etc for her business.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan, 21 years old, lives with his three siblings and his parents in a sector of Jordan called Irbid. Yazan is studying for a Bachelor of Economy and Business degree. Now is in his third year, he is planning to continue his studies in order to find a job in his field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. Because he lacks sufficient funds to pay for his upcoming semester fees, Yazan applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Lamya

texts.en:
Because Lamya is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Lamya was born in 1962. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Baqaa, with her husband and her five children. Her husband is a retired man.

One of Lamya's daughters is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration. She is in her second year. She is planning to work in her study field after graduation, in order to start supporting her family financially. She is only one step closer to reaching her goal. But Lamya doesn't have enough money to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees, in her Business Administration studies

loans.name: Blanca Yesenia

texts.es:
Blanca, es una joven de 24 años, está acompañada, es madre de dos niños, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Es una persona que le preocupa mucho el bienestar de su familia y por tal motivo hace 4 años por iniciativa propia estableció una venta de ropa en su casa, lo que le facilita estar pendiente de su familia y su negocio.
Comprará ropa femenina (variedad de estilos, colores y tallas). Teniendo su inventario muy surtido podrá ofrecer a sus clientes mejores opciones de compra y será beneficiada con ganancias más altas con las que cancelara la deuda, clientes satisfechos y un negocio más estable.
Sueña con forjar un patrimonio que le dé a sus hijos la oportunidad de ser profesionales y contar con un negocio muy rentable que le permita sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is a young woman 24 years old, who lives with her companion, and is the mother of 2 children. She lives in her own house with her life's companion and her children. She is a person who is very preoccupied for her family and for that reason, some 4 years ago, on her own initiative, she established a business selling clothing from her house. This makes it possible for her to be available for family and business.

Blanca will purchase women's clothes in a variety of styles, colors and sizes. Having her inventory more complete could offer her customers better purchase options and will be beneficial, offering higher earnings with which she can pay her debts, satisfy her customers, and advance her family.

Blanca dreams of forging a patrimony that may give her children the opportunity of becoming professionals and of being able to count on a very profitably business that will allow her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy additional women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser, age 25, operates a shop where he sells electrical appliances for home use. He lives with his parents and siblings in a small, old house in the city of Deir el Balah, and he helps support the family's needs with his earnings. 

Yaser opened his shop some years ago, and at present it is a very simple shop. It needs a good deal of development and support in order to bring it up to speed. He would like to add new products and expand his business. He has therefore applied for a Murabaha loan from FATEN. He will use his loan funds to buy a variety of products to offer for sale. 

He will use his expected profits to improve his business, to help support his family, and eventually to prepare a home in which to live with his future wife.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to offer for sale so that he can expand his inventory and improve his business

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is 37 years old and married, from Rafah city. He is the father of two sons and two daughters. Husam works as an employee in the public sector. 

He also works on his farm to provide his family all of what they need. For the past six years, Husam has been planting his land of seasonal crops and using greenhouses to insure a better quality for his products. 

Husam has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy the raw materials for building new greenhouses for his farm. 

By applying for this loan Husam's income will be increased. Husam appears in the photo on his farm

loans.use: to buy materials for building new greenhouses for his farm.

loans.name: Artiaga

texts.en:
Artiaga is married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Artiaga is 59 years old, and she has one child who is still in school.

Artiaga has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like fabrics, buttons, zippers, etc., for her business.

Artiaga has been in this business for 20 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabrics, buttons, zippers, etc., for her business

loans.name: Ma. Victorina

texts.en:
Ma. Victorina is 46 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Victorina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Victorina has been fattening pigs for five years, and she also earns income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Mary Jane has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years now.

Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James always knew he wanted to be his own boss. Years ago, when he became seriously ill, James decided to leave his accounting job and start his own health and life insurance business. With over six years of experience in the industry, James took this opportunity to work in a less stressful environment and pursue his dream.

Now with two offices, one based out of Clark and one out of Bloomfield, James’s business is thriving. Along with another business partner, who is soon retiring, James works with over 200 commissioned partners in the industry.

When his father passed away two months ago, James took the tragedy, like his previous illness, as an opportunity for change. The funds from this loan will help James’ business move into a new office and help purchase supplies, such as a fax machine, a copier, a computer, desks, and file cabinets.

loans.use: To purchase office equipment such as a fax machine, copier, desks, etc

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Because Khadija is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Khadija was born in 1965. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Madaba, with her husband and her eight children. Her husband is a retired man.

One of Khadija's daughters is studying toward a Bachelor's degree in Counseling Psychology. She is in her last year. She is planning to work in her study field after graduation, in order to start supporting her family financially. She is only one step closer to reaching her goal. But Khadija doesn't have enough money to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees, so she can complete her degree in Counseling Psychology

loans.name: Khamees

texts.en:
Khamees was born in 1965. He is single and lives at a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour, with his brother and sister. Khamees has been responsible for his siblings since his parents' death. He is trying his best to provide them with all that they need. Khamees has been selling hot drinks and herbal drinks at his house, for three years. He started his project with a small amount of money. He has found it to be a good source of income, to cover his siblings' needs and to support himself. He is planning to expand his business in the future, by opening his own cafe.

Now, he wants to raise his profit by getting a larger amount of coffee and herbs. In addition, he wants to add snacks and food products to his project, which will raise his sales and income. But he doesn't have enough money for these things. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more coffee, herbs and food products, to sell at his business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan, age 40, currently works in the public sector as an employee, where he earns a very low income. In order to better support his wife and seven children, he has decided to go into business for himself by buying a rickshaw, which he will use to transfer goods to local traders. 

Hasan lives with his wife, four sons, and three daughters in the city of Rafah. At present, his income barely covers the family's needs. He would like to provide his family with the best living conditions he can offer them. His new business will increase his income and improve the family's standard of living.
 
Hasan has reqyuested a Murabaha loan from FATEN in order to help him buy his rickshaw and start up his business.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw, which he will use to transfer goods to local traders

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 59 years old and she has one child who is still in school.

Norma has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her business, like fabric, thread, and zippers.

Norma has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business, like fabric, thread, and zippers.

loans.name: Pritse

texts.en:
Pritse, age 59 and unmarried, runs a general store to earn an income. She sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, vinegar, cooking oil, biscuits, and noodles. Pritse works very hard and has operated her business for 10 years.

Pritse has requested a PhP 23,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy a variety of items to offer for sale in her general store.
 
In the future, Pritse would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Roqueta

texts.en:
Roqueta works hard to support her family. Roqueta is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Roqueta requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Roqueta has been in this business for 10 years now.

Roqueta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 56 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Sabina works very hard to provide for her family.

Sabina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items like candies, snack foods, canned goods, soy sauce, coffee, etc. to sell.

Sabina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, canned goods, soy sauce, coffee, etc. 

Sabina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like candies, snack foods, canned goods, soy sauce, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Teresita has a general store business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items like eggs, noodles, ketchup, cooking oil, milk, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like eggs, noodles, ketchup, cooking oil, milk, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. She is married and she has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Vicenta requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more vegetables to sell. Vicenta has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Yolanda is 43 years old, and both children are in school.

Yolanda has a business direct selling personal-collection products in the Philippines. Yolanda has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional personal-collection products to sell to her customers.

Yolanda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal-collection products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a fish vendor. She earns an additional income from operating a general store. She and her husband have three children, and she works very hard to support her family.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a new loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will use her loan funds to buy fish to offer for sale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn earns an income by selling purified drinking water. She has been engaged in her business for the past four years. She works hard to support her family.
 
Evelyn has requested a PhP 27,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase containers of purified drinking water to offer for sale.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase containers of purified drinking water to offer for sale

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is 21 years old. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her six siblings and her parents. Alaa is studying for a bachelor's of Water Resources and Environment. She is in her last year and is one step closer to graduation. She is planning to continue her study to find a good job in her study field after graduation to start helping her parents financially as they are currently facing financial crisis, which is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Odelia

texts.en:
Odelia is a single mother of four who is completely dependent on her income to support her family. With the help of her mother Mariam, she was able to open her micro enterprise, a clothing store in Jerusalem which they both own and manage.  Initially the store sold household goods and supplies, but they soon realized that their neighborhood needed a clothing store catering to religious women.

With the help of her mother, Odelia is making a better future for her children. At this time she has a part-time job in the morning to supplement her income while her mother watches over the shop. She knows her store has real potential and one day wants to manage it full time and earn a decent living that will provide for her family.

Odelia has requested this loan to purchase a stock of dresses and clothing for religious women.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of dresses and clothing for religious women.

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Nora tiene 54 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos los cuales colaboran en casa en las diferentes actividades que a diario se realizan como también en el campo. Ella es ama de casa, maestra de educación primaria y agricultura actividad que aprendió gracias a su familia ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones y hoy en día lo ejerce junto a su esposo. Doña Nora en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos se involucran en las diferentes actividades que se realizan en la agricultura como ser: la recolección del grano, limpieza de la tierra y la planta, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros dando el mantenimiento correcto a sus plantas de café. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundario completo con lo que pudo graduarse de maestra en educación primaria gracias al apoyo financiero y moral de sus padres.
Ella solicita financiamiento para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de insumos entre otros para fertilizar y abonarlos para que el final de la temporada pueda obtener una buena cosecha.
En un futuro ella espera adquirir un pedazo más de tierra poder heredar a sus hijos y que ellos puedan construir sus hogares físicamente para que puedan enfrentar los problemas económicos y demás de manera favorable ya que la agricultura es su único medio de ingreso para cubrir las diferentes necesidades que a diario surgen. También poder darle la oportunidad a su hijo menor para que pueda ingresar a la universidad y se pueda graduar.
texts.en:
Nora is 54 years old.  She is the mother of three children who work together daily to perform various activities at home as well as in the field.  She is a housewife, primary school teacher, and farmer.  She learned this trade thanks to her family because they have been farmers for generations, and today she works with her husband.  Nora, her husband, and her children are involved in various agricultural activities such as gathering grain, clearing and planting the land, applying manure, fertilizer, and leaf fertilizer, and other duties to provide their coffee plants with proper maintenance.  Thanks to her parents’ moral and financial support, she completed secondary school, which enabled her to qualify as a primary school teacher.

She is requesting the loan to purchase inputs including fertilizer and manure to maintain her coffee crops and, in this way, be able to obtain a good harvest at the end of the season.  In the future, she hopes to acquire another piece of land and leave it to her children so that they can build homes. In addition, she hopes to be able to tackle their financial and other problems favorably as farming is their only means of income to pay for the needs that arise daily.  Also, she wishes to provide her youngest son with the opportunity to enroll at the university and graduate

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs to maintain  and care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Srey Leak

texts.en:
Srey Leak, age 20 and unmarried, lives with her parents on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her parents are farmers.
 
Srey Leak is now a third-year student at the University of Law and Economics in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan in order to pay her school fees.  
 
Srey Leak will graduate with her degree in 2015. Her goal is to obtain employment at a salary of approximately $250 a month.

loans.use: to pay her school fees

loans.name: Sreyleav

texts.en:
Sreyleav, age 18 and unmarried, lives with her parents on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her parents are farmers.

Sreyleav has just finished her baccalaureate studies. She would like to continue her education by pursuing a Bachelor's degree in finance and banking at the university. For this reason, she has decided to apply for a loan. She will use her loan funds to pay her school fees.
 
Sreyleav will graduate with her Bachelor's degree in 2017. She hopes to gain employment at a salary of approximately $250 per month.

loans.use: to pay her school fees

loans.name: Shampa

texts.en: Shampa is a 23-year-old married woman. She is illiterate, just knowing how to sign her name. Her poverty has not allowed her to receive an education. Now Shampa is a mother of two children and both of them go to school. She has taken a loan to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is a farmer. Both Shampa and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children and provide them with a better life. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream come true. Now Shampa lives in a Kaccha house (made of straw & mud), but with the profit they hope to build a Pakka house (made of bricks & cement).

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina, age 45, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, eggs, and canned goods. She is married and works very hard to provide for her family.

Fedelina has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will use her loan funds to buy a variety of items to offer for sale in her general store.

She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Al-Shayma Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Shayma, which consists of six ladies.

Haimia is 47 years old and married, with children, and she lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She faces a bad situation, and her husband`s income doesn`t cover her family`s expenses. Her own fridge is not working well, so sometimes she goes to her neighbors to keep her food and soft drinks in their fridge, lacking the money to buy a new fridge. 

So she is requesting a loan from AMB that will help pay for a fridge to keep her food and soft drinks, instead of her old fridge. 

She hopes to own a retail shop to increase her profit. This will ensure a better future and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to help pay for a fridge to keep her food and soft drinks instead of her old fridge.

loans.name: Rethwan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rethwan and it consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Fatima is a 33-year-old married woman with children who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a hardworking housewife and tries to provide for her family. 

Fatima has a small house and she doesn't have money to improve her house. So she is requesting a loan to buy furniture for her home. In the future, she hopes to finish building her house to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Nelen

texts.en:
Nelen is 58 years old and married with nine children.  With three children in school, Nelen works very hard to provide for them.

Nelen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nelen has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft drinks, bread and other groceries. 

In the future Nelen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 29 years old and married, with four children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for two years, and she also earns an income from buying and selling crabs.

Marilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun (in the photo) has just finished his baccalaureate and he wants to continue his bachelor's degree at a Finance and Banking University. Hence, he has decided to apply for a loan to pay for his school fees.

Sokhoeun is 18 years old and single. He lives with his parents on an island of the Mekong River.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Phearun

texts.en:
Phearun, age 19 and unmarried, lives with his parents and brothers and sisters in a suburb of Phnom Pen. His parents are farmers. 
 
Phearun has just finished his baccalaureate studies. His goal is to continue his education by pursuing studies in nursing at the university in Phnom Penh City. 

He has decided to apply for a loan in order to pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay his school fees

loans.name: Sreyleak’S Group

texts.en:
Sreyleak was selected to be the group leader of this group of two borrowers. The other borrower is named Vanyork. Both borrowers live in a village some distance from Phnom Penh City.

Sreyleak, age 21, and unmarried (pictured at right), is a traditional singer living with her parents. She would like to pursue studies in law and public administration at the university in Phnom Penh City. Her loan funds will allow her to pay her school fees. 
 
Vanyork, age 19 and unmarried, is a traditional musician living with his parents. His goal is to study law at the university in Phnom Penh. He will pay his school fees with his loan funds.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Shafali

texts.en: Shafali is a 51-year-old married woman and her husband is 64 years old. Shafali is illiterate and her husband is a class VIII pass (grade 8) graduate. Shafali has two children and both the children are receiving an education. They live in a small town in the Maynaguri region. Her husband runs a grocery shop but sales have not been good due to the limited variety of products, so their family is struggling. She is taking a loan of INR 10,000 for purchasing new and different grocery items, hoping the sales will increase and provide greater profits.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn buys and sells charcoal to earn her living. She earns an additional income from operating a general store. As the married mother of three children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of PhP 18,000, and she will use her loan funds to purchase sacks of charcoal to offer for sale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Kongvanny

texts.en:
Kongvanny, age 18 and unmarried, lives with her parents and her brothers and sisters in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has just finished her baccalaureate studies.
 
Kongvanny wishes to pursue a higher level education and attend university. She has decided to apply for a loan in order to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to pay university school fees

loans.name: Reaksmey

texts.en:
Reaksmey (pictured here) is 19 years old and single. She lives with her widowed mother, sister, and brother in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother is a farmer.

Reaksmey has applied for a loan. She will use money from the loan to pay her first-year credit to study for a bachelor's degree in Cambodia: There are four years, which are divided into two semesters each year, first and second semester. And students can choose to pay school fees with a year or by semester, depending on school or university policy.

loans.use: To pay her school fees.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lucila has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from buying and selling bamboo.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 40 years old and married, with three children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries, like soap, soft-drinks and other items.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 15 years, and she also earns an income from fish vending.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, like soap, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Becoming a commercial engineer has always been Maribel's dream. She expects to graduate in February 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Maribel shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With this loan, Maribel plans on using the funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Chuquisaca. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Maribel currently works 25 hours a week and earns $8 a day. With a career in commercial engineering, she expects to earn $22 a day, a substantial increase from before. Maribel's parents were never able to complete their primary education. As the youngest of three, with two older siblings attending college already, Maribel is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru: Фаррух начинающий бизнесмен. Ему 30 лет. Имеет жену и троих маленьких детей. Фаррух со своей семьей живет в районе Яван в доме родителей, поскольку не имеет собственного дома. Он планирует открыть такой прибыльный бизнес, за счет которого в будущем он смог бы купить квартиру и жить со своей семьей отдельно. Фаррух на свои сбережения уже построил помещение и хочет использовать его в качестве продуктового магазина. Он оснастил магазин всеми необходимыми принадлежностями и теперь осталось только закупить продукты, чтобы начать торговлю. Фаррух для реализации цели обратился за кредитом. Он просит в кредит 3000 долларов США для приобретения широкого ассортимента продуктов питания. Он очень нуждается в данном кредите. Ведь благодаря этому кредиту он откроет не только прибыльный бизнес, но и в будущем сможет купить квартиру для своей семьи. Он очень хочет и стремится, чтобы у него была собственная крыша над головой. Фаррух верит, что его поддержат.
texts.en: \Farrukh is a beginning entrepreneur. He is 30 years old. He is married and has three young children. Farrukh lives with his family in his parents’ house in the Yavan region since he does not have a house on his own. He plans to launch a profitable business so that in the future he would be able to buy an apartment and live independently with his own family. He has already built a store using his savings and would like to open a grocery store there. He has already equipped the store with everything necessary, and all that is needed to start selling is to stock up on groceries. To achieve this goal, Farrukh has applied for a loan. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 USD in order to buy a wide variety of groceries. He really needs this loan. Thanks to his loan he will not only launch a business brining him income, but also will be able to buy an apartment for his family. He eagerly wishes to have his own home. Farrukh hopes that he will get support.

loans.use: to stock up on groceries so as to launch a grocery store.

loans.name: Sotheara

texts.en:
Sotheara (pictured here), age 22, is single. He lives with his parents in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sotheara is now in second year and first semester of his university. He applies for a loan to pay for his school fees. In addition, he is also a credit officer for Microfinance in Phnom Penh.
Credit to study bachelor degree in Cambodia: There are four years and divided into two semesters each year, first and second semester. And students can prefer to pay school fees with a year or by semester depending on school or university privacy policy.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other materials

loans.name: Durgarani

texts.en:
Durgarani is a 27-year-old hardworking housewife from Tekatuli village. She has a husband named Dilip who is 33 years old and they have two children.  She and her husband have a secondary education up to class eight (Grade 8). Durgarani dreams that her children will be able to get a proper education and become responsible and good citizens. Her children are in standard six (grade 6) and one (grade 1). 

Durgarani and her husband are involved in preparing electrical boards, which are used for outlets and switches in homes and businesses. Experience in this field and demand in the region is the reason they chose this business. After getting the loan she wants to purchase wood for preparing the electric boards. In the future she wants to extent her business and wishes to build a concrete house with the profit. Durgarani is a shining example of success.

loans.use: To purchase wood for preparing electrical boards.

loans.name: Manjali

texts.en:
Manjali is 35 years old and her husband, Shamal, is a farmer. They live in a small hut in Tekatuli village, Maynaguri. Manjali is a hardworking housewife and has a basic education. She and her husband have their own land where they cultivate different vegetables in different seasons and sell those vegetables in the market, including broad beans. Having their own land and experience in the agricultural field is the reason for choosing this business. 

Manjali helps her husband in the field. She wishes to take this loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She wants to extend her land in the future and plans to build a concrete house for living. Environmental disasters like drought, flood and famine are the main challenges in her agricultural business. 

Manjali wants to prosper in life. Manjali is a very ambitious and courageous lady, who never gives up the fight before she wins.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds for her agriculture business

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell. .

Nimfa has been in this business for five years. Nimfa earns more income from her general store.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money   to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sokra

texts.en:
Sokra (in the photo), age 20, is single, lives with his parents on Island of Mekong River. His parents are farmers and raise cows at home. 
Sokra is now in first year and first semester of his Finance and Banking University. He applies for a loan to pay for his school fees.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 34 years old, married with one kid, who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cristina has a general store business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Cristina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea, 31, is a married mother of two children. Both of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rhea has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Rhea would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nayme

texts.en:
Nayme is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, soft drinks, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Nayme has been in this business for 4 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Nayme has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, soft drinks, eggs, etc

loans.name: Promila

texts.en:
Promila is a housewife from Tekatuli village, Mayanaguri, Jaipaiguri District. She is 47 years old, married to Madhu, and has two children who are studying in class seven and five (grades 7 and 5). She wants her children to lead a very successful life with a good education. Promila is not very educated, but studied up to standard five (grade 5). 

Promila has her own incense business. She is experienced in this field; that’s why she has chosen this business. After taking the loan from BJS she wants to improve her business and purchase raw materials. She gives a supply of incense to the local shops and her incense has a great demand in the locality. The strike of the labor creates a great difficulty in her business, but any difficulties cannot stop her to grow in her life as well as to flourish in her business. Because she is a very courageous lady, she gives support to her husband and family. Her self-confidence and enormous skill make her a good entrepreneur, which helps her to increase their economic and social condition.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her incense business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, and her husband is 30 years old. Anita has completed class VII (grade 7) and her husband completed class V (grade 5). Her husband is a laborer, but his income is not enough. Providing education for two children and running a household is very difficult for them, so Anita decided to do something so that she can also earn money and contribute to her family. 

In her childhood she learned stitching and knitting so she thought to do this as her business for now. She thought to buy a sewing machine so that she can improve her skill and earn money. For this reason she has applied for a loan and she has already started to take orders for preparing dresses. She hopes she will succeed in her life.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her new dressmaking business

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Panha (in the photo), age 18, is single. She lives with her parents, on an island of the Mekong River. Panha is now in the second year of her Nursing studies at a University in Phnom Penh City. She applied for a loan to pay for her school fees.

In the future, Panha hopes she will become a good nurse and get a salary of about $400 a month.

loans.use: To pay for her Nursing studies at University

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika (in the photo), age 18, is single. She lives with her widowed mother, on an island of the Mekong River. Her mother is a weaver.

Kanika has just finished her baccalaureate, and she wants to continue her studies in university. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to pay school fees. She plans to major in psychology.

loans.use: To pay for her university fees and study for a degree in psychology

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha (in the photo) lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has been married since 2005 and has one son and one daughter. 

Sokha and her husband are sesame and bean farmers. Additionally, she is weaver and her husband raises cows at home. She is requesting a loan in order to assist her farming business by buying seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Kin (in the photo) lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She now stays at home. She has two sons and two daughters; one is married and she is a garment worker, one is a construction worker and the other two have full-time employment. 

The main source of income is from her husband and children. Her husband is a 'moto kangbei' taxi driver. In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

Kin wants to buy a motorbike for her daughter, who is a garment worker to drive to work. But she does not have money. Hence she decided to apply for a loan to make the purchase.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 55-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven daughters and four sons. 
She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a shoe maker by profession; he has been making shoes since his childhood so he has a lot of experience in his profession. He wishes that his elder son also learn the techniques for shoe making but he is not interested in this profession. He makes shoes by hands and his hand made shoes are very famous in his hometown. Previously he provides only services to his clients for shoe making, now he has gotten lot of market experience and wants to buy material his own for shoe making, so that he could better earn than past. 

This is the reason, Fatima requested a loan from Kiva's field partner so that her husband could buy raw material for making shoes. She has been taking loan from BRAC Pakistan and cherish her family through profit amount. Fatima is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making shoes to sell.

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is 55 years old, married mother of six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lelanie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lelanie requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

Lelanie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lelanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three daughters and a son.

Her husband is a very hard-working and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers various types of delicious food. He had been working as a chef in a well-known hotel for many years, and  now he has opened his own restaurant. He cooks delicious food for his restaurant and people like to eat at his restaurant. 

He wants to offer more dishes according to demand but he does not have enough money to buy more variety of food items. Therefore, Fouzia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy more food items to offer. She thanks Kiva and appreciates the kind support for her.

loans.use: To buy food item such as pulses (lentils), flour, beef and chicken for restaurant.

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning is 45 years old and married with six children.

Luningning works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like spices, canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

Luningning has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile cards.

Luningning aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like spices, canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and married, with five children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell, like chips, bread, soap, and canned goods.

Maria has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and she also earns an income from a buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Maria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like chips, bread, soap, and canned goods.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is a 24-year-old woman, who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children; now they are growing up, and their needs are growing, as well.

A couple of years ago, Ramzana took a loan and purchased an auto rickshaw for her husband. (She covered part of the price with savings.) Now, the body structure of the auto rickshaw has depreciated, due to jerks during driving on poorly-maintained roads.  Now it creates a rattling noise during driving, which is irritating for passengers. Her husband spends most of his income on household expenses, and they do not have savings to buy a new rickshaw body.

Therefore, Ramzana again contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She described her financial problem. The field staff checked out her previous repayment behavior and gave approval for a new loan. Her husband will buy a new body for the rickshaw, so that he could provide comfort to his customers, with a safe journey.

She seems very happy over this honorable act, and she says "thank you," to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto rickshaw body for her husband to use

loans.name: Chany

texts.en:
Chany (in the photo) is a widowed mother, with one son and one daughter. She lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Chany is a garment worker. She is applying for a loan to connect her house to the electrical utility service because she uses electricity from her sister. She will also use a part of the loan to fill in the land under her house.

loans.use: to connect her house to the electrical utility service and to fill in the land under her house.

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Narissa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Narissa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, cooking oil, etc for her food vending business.

Narissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a 48-year-old, married woman. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s fruit-selling business. Her husband owns a fruit-selling business, in a nearby fruit market. Because of the increase in their household expenses, she wants to grow the business. Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. The loan will enable her husband to buy fresh fruits to sell, and a new scale to measure the weight.

Sakina is the mother of six children. Her children are students, and none of them is able to get income. They are fully dependent upon their father. She wants to save the profit earned by using this loan, so that she could face any sudden incident, or medical treatment for her children. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her, and that she will save a reasonable amount, soon. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits to sell, and a new scale for measuring the weight.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 48-year-old married woman. She has a large family, consisting of seven children and a husband. She lives in a joint family in a small house. She belongs to a poor family and meets her needs only with much diffculty. 

Her husband is a shoe seller by profession. He doesn't have a shop; he sell shoes at his home. This is the only source of income for his family. Presently he needs to purchase material for making shoes, including leather, thread, and one more stitching machine. 

For that reason, his wife has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to continue his work. Shehnaz hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase material for making shoes, including leather, thread, and one more stitching machine.

loans.name: Arsena

texts.en:
Arsena is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling charcoal, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income by fattening pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Arsena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
Nazaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like fish, meat, chicken, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Nazaria has been in this business for 34 years. Nazaria earns more income from farming rice.

Nazaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like fish, meat, chicken, spices, etc

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 51 years old and married. She has five children. She earns a living by pig fattening, in the Philippines. Maria Fe has been fattening pigs for nine years, and she earns additional income from keeping a general store.

Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is 32 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a business selling un-stitched clothing, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Presently, he needs some additional capital for the growth of his business. To obtain the capital, Irum is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will provide the loan funds to her husband, for use in the business. He will use the funds to purchase a variety of cloth to sell, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit amount, he will put aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bills.

Irum hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cloth to sell.

loans.name: Robi

texts.en:
Robi, age 34, is a mother of six children. 

Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including thread, needles, and clothing. This is very important in order for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife, Robi, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. Robi is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for her husband's shop, including thread, needles, and clothing.

loans.name: Sony Group

texts.en:
Frida, who is in her late 50s, is a widow with two children. One of them is still in college, and one grandchild is also going to school.  She has been running a business growing and harvesting sunflowers, and blending the seeds into cooking oil. She also buys from others to make more oil; she has been in this business for four years.  She works from 8.00 am to 8.00 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Frida's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She also used the previous loans to grow sunflowers to make into cooking oil.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay college fees, and saved some in the bank.  

She will use this loan to buy more seeds and grow sunflowers for producing cooking oil. 

She dreams of improving her life style.

Frida will share this loan with her loan group "SONY", which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow sunflowers for producing cooking oil.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 37 años, es divorciada y tiene dos hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia.
