Sonia tiene una tienda de comestibles en donde atiende desde muy temprano a vecinos y amigos de su localidad quienes acuden a la comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, conservas entre otros. No obstante al ser un negocio muy concurrido posee clientes a quienes les brindo al crédito productos de primera necesidad y demoran en cancelarle el importe perjudicando de alguna manera sus ganancias finales. A manera de surtir nuevamente su negocio desea contar con capital de trabajo y proceder con la compra de más mercadería esperando mantener o aumentar la concurrencia de sus clientes. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor como son sacos de arroz, azúcar, conservas, cereales, verduras; entre otros.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and is divorced. She has two daughters who live with her in their own home. Sonia has a small store that she attends to early in the morning for neighbors and friends from the neighborhood who often buy basic goods including rice, sugar, preserves and other items. Although she gets a lot of business, she has some customers who she offered products to on credit and they are delaying in paying back, which is damaging her final profit. 

In order to stock her busienss again, she hopes to access working capital to proceed with the purchase of more goods, in hopes of maintaining or even increasing her business. This is her second Kiva loan and she feels very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She is also committed to paying her monthly installments in a punctual manner. This time, she hopes to receive 2000 nuevos soles to buy goods at wholesale prices including sacks of rice, sugar, preserves, grains, vegetables and other items.

loans.use: to buy food products including rice, sugar, and preserves.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and married with two children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loads.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Letty has been in this business for 26 years. Letty earns more income from farming rice.

Letty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 27 years old and single. She helps her family to earn a living.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening. Daisy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell at her store, like soap, toothpaste, milk, sugar, and shampoo.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream - to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like milk, sugar and soap

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. She earns additional income by raising pigs.

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell at her greengrocery business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby is 38 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Ruby is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Ruby has been pig-fattening for nine years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, está casada, es madre de tres hijos y vive junto a ellos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y la apoyan en los gastos de la casa, es una señora que se dedica a la crianza de ganado y siembra de  granos básicos desde hace 15 años; está actividad la ejerció a raíz de la necesidad de llevar a su casa el apoyo necesario para que sus hijos tuvieran una buena alimentación y educación. Su horario de trabajo es 5:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de alimento para ganado e insumos agrícolas (herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono); para ampliar su negocio y aumentar su productividad.
Desea tener más ganado, un área de siembra más grande a la que tiene hoy, generar ganancias para mejorar su vida familiar y cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
María is married and the mother of three children who live with her.  They're older and help her with the household expenses.

María has raised cattle and grown basic grains for 15 years.  She did this work because she needed to support her household so her children had good nutrition and an education.  She works from 5 a.m. until 3 p.m.

María's going to invest the money in cattle feed and agricultural inputs (herbicide, pesticide, and soil amendments) to expand her business and increase her productivity.

She wants to have more cattle and a bigger field to plant than what she currently has as well as to generate profit to improve her family life and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy food for her cattle and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Mira Flor

texts.en:
Mira Flor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Mira Flor has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Mira Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha, 57, is a hardworking woman. Her husband owns a furniture shop, the only source of income for the family. He manufactures furniture and sells it in the main market. 

He needs to purchase wood, varnish, needles, etc. This will help him continue his work, and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed things. 

Therefore his wife, Ayesha, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.  

Ayesha is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wood, varnish, needles, etc

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 31 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, soft drinks, noodles and school supplies.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analiza would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 33 years old and married. She has two children. Emily works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy more stock to sell at her store, like soap, milk, coffee, and soft drinks. Emily has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like soap, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosario is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Bibelonie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Bibelonie works hard to support her family. She has an abacca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Bibelonie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials, like abacca fiber, for her abacca weaving business. 

Bibelonie has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials, like abacca fiber, for her business

loans.name: Ma. Josie

texts.en:
Ma. Josie is 46 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a vehicle repair business, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years.

Ma. Josie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy new equipment and tools for her to use in repairing vehicles. In the future, Ma. Josie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and tools, for her to use in repairing vehicles.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is a 28-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past several years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income received to support her entire family.

Her sewing machine has become out of order, due to continuously working. However, due to a lack of savings and funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine. The new machine will be a means of increasing revenue, so she may generate a healthier amount of income. She hopes that this loan will prove positive and beneficial for her, and will be the cause for earning more income. Neelam thanks Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en:
Rehmat, age 52, is a mother of five children. 

Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material, like thread, an embroidery machine, and needles. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

Rehmat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

Rehmat is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of embroidery material, like thread, an embroidery machine, and needles.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalia is 41 years old and all of her children are in school.

Rosalia has a vehicle repair business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her vehicle repairs.

Rosalia has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 46, is a mother of five children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new variety of embroidery material to resell. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of money he finds it difficult. 

For that his wife, Samina, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials like a variety of colorful thread, needles, pearls, beads, etc. Samina is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase an embroidery machine and new variety of embroidery materials like a variety of colorful thread, needles, pearls, beads, etc.

loans.name: Robina Group

texts.en:
Robina is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. She is a member of a two person borrowing group requesting a loan of 60,000 PKR from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan.

She wants the financing to buy raw materials for her husband’s welding shop. 

As this shop is the only source of income for their family, she wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy.
 
Her husband is very experienced, and a professional in his dealings; he has been operating his business for the past seven years. 

Robina is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them, and bring positive changes in the life of their family.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials for her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like bread, candy, chips, eggs, noodles, etc., for her general store business.

Novelita has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

Novelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like bread, candy, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 50 years old and married with six children.

Estelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like rice, milk, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Estelita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

Estelita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like rice, milk, shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mercedes es de las personas con iniciativa propia luchan dia a dia para salir adelante junto a su familia, su esposo le apoya incondicionalmente al igual que su hija, quien vive en la misma casa junto, la actividad comercial de Mercedes es la venta de Ropa de segunda, zapatos y algunos encargo que sus clientes le piden, el credito lo solicita para comprar mercaderia y aprovechar asi la temporada de estos meses festivos, agradece el apoyo que le han brindado Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en:
Mercedes is one of those people with her own initiative who fights day by day to get ahead alongside her family. She supports her husband unconditionally, the same for her daughter, who lives in the same house with her. Mercedes' business is the sale of second-hand clothing, shoes and other items that her customers order.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy merchandise and take advantage of the holiday months. She is thankful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have given her.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene manages a general store business in her village of Antagan. Having a PHP 8,000 revolving capital in the business is lacking, thus she is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy more goods to offer like rice, canned goods, seasonings, and more. She also would like to add other products, like buying frozen foods to retail. Her income from retailing went toward the feed maintenance of her hog-raising business, which is her other source of income. 

Her husband, on the other hand, served as an on-call carpenter and also operates a motorcycle transport when not in the carpentry job. She is already 32 years old and a mother of two school-aged children in the elementary level. She is so patient in managing her business from 4:30 in the morning till 8:30 in the evening.

loans.use: to buy more goods to offer like rice, canned goods, seasonings, and more. She also would like to add other products, like buying frozen foods to retail.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her abaca-weaving business

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 45-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an unstitched clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. He purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market. 

Presently, he needs funds to continue his work. For that Rukhsana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of ladies unstitched clothing to sell. This way he can respond quickly to customer needs. Rukhsana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fardous

texts.en:
Fardous is a 43-year-old lady, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is a responsible mother; two of her children have reached the age of marriage. She wants to make some savings so that she could provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to replace the auto rickshaw body with a new one, but he does not have sufficient funds to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Fardous requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy the auto rickshaw body.
 
She hopes that she would be able to make enough saving till the time of their marriage.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is 36 years old and has five children. She is married and has five children who are in school.  Anecia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anecia has been pig fattening for nine years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business selling fish, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Charito requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Misael De Jesus

texts.es: Misael de 33 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 13 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Misael  está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Misael, 33, has been making his living in agriculture since he was 13. This has given him the ability and necessary knowledge to help his crops. His principal crops are corn and beans. He sells his crops in basic grain agencies that are near his place of residence. With the earnings that he obtains from his sales he helps out with the expenses that his family has. He lives with his wife and their two children.

Misael is applying for a loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies like manure, seeds, and fertilizers in order to be able to have better income and continue helping in the expenses of his house without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials needed for her repair shop business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials needed for her repair shop

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maria Liza works hard to support her family.

She has an abacca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods. 

Maria Liza is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more abacca fiber and other materials for her business.

Maria Liza successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more abacca fiber and other materials for her business

loans.name: Firdous

texts.en:
Firdous is a 45-year-old, married woman, and a mother of three daughters. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city, and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling quality clothes in her community.

She requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. The loan will enable her to buy different clothes for the winter season. By taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers, she expects to be able to achieve greater sales.

She is in her third loan cycle and has exhibited strong repayment behavior. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children, through all her hard efforts in her business. Firdous thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes to resell for the winter season.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 32 years old and married. She has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs, in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for seven years, and she earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

Melanie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wilna

texts.en:
Wilna Trinidad is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a coconut vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year, and she earns additional income by from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more coconuts to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

Wilna Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovis is a 56-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He mainly grows tomatoes and rears goats in order to earn a living. Like most farmers he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and diseases, while his dream is to become the leading tomato producer in the area. The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university level. Clovis is requesting a loan to buy goats for rearing and sprays for his tomato garden.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing and sprays for his tomato garden.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 47 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of six children. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband owns an un-stitched clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. He purchases a variety of cloth from different areas, and sells them in the main market.

Presently, her husband needs additional capital for the growth of the business. For the capital, Kousar is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will use the loan funds to purchase a variety of ladies' un-stitched cloth to sell. This will enable him to respond quickly to customer needs. Kousar hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fabrics to sell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
A $600 US loan is offered to Manuela. She will use the loan to improve her business. She has a pigsty, where many people come to buy. Manuela will buy some additional animals, such as pigs and horses. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels very comfortable to run her business, because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Manuela independent, and she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business, in the future.

loans.use: To buy pigs and horses

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy beer, soda, and local brew to sell. She is a hardworking woman, who has been operating a bar in Hoima, Uganda, for the past eight years. The high cost of rent and inadequate capital to meet the high demand are her major business challenges.

Being the good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University level, and also to set up sustainable income-generating activities to secure their future. Her dream is to own a modern bar in the center of town.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, and local brew to sell.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Rose is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Rose has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mary Rose requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Mary Rose has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Rose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Timbo

texts.en:
Migrating from Thailand to Florida, Timbo says he only planned to be in United States for two years to learn English, but instead, he moved to New Orleans and has lived in the USA for 29 years.

Timbo first began creating his hand-made, one-of-a-kind macramé and beaded accessories after noticing someone else doing it on the side of the street. Knowing he could improve on the different styles he saw, he decided to enter that industry. The business began half-heartedly in 1994. Timbo got tired of it and quit. That was years before Hurricane Katrina.

Just like many New Orleans’ citizens, Timbo was affected by Hurricane Katrina, which consumed many homes and lives. Left homeless, Timbo lost everything he had worked for to the hurricane. Remembering the work he did when he first migrated to New Orleans, Timbo looked to nonprofit microlender, Accion Texas Inc. for business support.  

It wasn’t hard for him to go back to work, but the Bourbon Street office job wasn’t for him. So he saved enough money to purchase a van, lived in it, and then went to work in the French Market. Only this time, he became serious about his work and took advantage that there wasn’t anyone else doing it.

His first loan in 2011 helped purchase inventory as he worked his way out of the van he was living in and into an apartment. Now the business is succeeding and Timbo is saving money to fund his home deposit. 

Recently, Timbo completed the first-time homebuyer course and is working to save money for a deposit on a house. Remembering the passionate work of the Accion employees, Timbo returned for a second loan to purchase inventory, catch up on some bills, and save for working capital when the weather slows traffic on the French Market. 

If his business continues to be a success, he’ll be able to purchase a home for the first time.

He says if he needs additional funding for his business, “I’m gonna go back to Accion again. They’re great people, I love them.”

loans.use: to purchase inventory, pay bills and use for working capital

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Crisales works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling pre-paid mobile minutes.

Crisales is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase an additional stock of goods to sell at her general store, like soap, milk, sugar, and noodles.

Crisales has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of goods to sell at her general store, like soap, milk, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Letecia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, eggs, cooking oil, vegetables, etc for her food vending business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, eggs, cooking oil, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz, age 33, is a mother of three daughters. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. This purchase will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

For this reason, his wife Mumtaz, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. Mumtaz is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful for Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Delma has been in this business for one year. Delma earns more income from her general store.

Delma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa wishes to borrow a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP. She will buy diapers, powdered milk, and drinks to sell, in her village. Felisa is forty years old, and a widowed mother of three children. Her children are attending schools that are in between elementary and college level. Felisa depends only on her income to her retail store, so that she will provide her children's fees for school. She owns a tricycle, and she sometimes operates a transportation business using it, for additional income. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will be able to meet the needs of her children and also to improve her business more.

loans.use: to buy diapers, powdered milk, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Naila Group

texts.en:
Naila is 32 years old and a married woman. She has three children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a member of a two-person borrowing group, and they have requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.
 
Naila plans to use her portion of the loan for her husband. He owns a gym, a business in which he has 12 years of experience. He always tries to provide the best environment to his customers. With the loan proceeds, he will invest in more of the latest exercise machines, to offer better quality services to his customers. He has great investor's skills, and his customers are very pleased with his gym services.

Naila's personal goals are to educate her children and to build a permanent home. She is hoping that the loan will bring considerable growth to their monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for additional gym equipment.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Salvador de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él se dedica hacer viajes en su vehículo por las diferentes  colonias de donde el reside, muchas personas lo prefieren por la amabilidad y responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, salvador está solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos y llantas para su vehículo ya que esa es la única fuente de trabajo y así poder llevar el sustento diario a su hogar sin limitaciones alguna.
texts.en:
Salvador is 47 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and  four children. He works making trips with his vehicle through the different areas in which he lives. Many people prefer him for his friendliness and responsibility which he displays while driving. With what he makes from his work he manages to pay some of his household expenses.

Salvador is requesting a loan to buy replacement parts and tires for his vehicle. This is the only source of income that he has and with the loan he can earn the daily bread for his household with no problems.

loans.use: to buy auto parts and tires.

loans.name: Jeannilyn

texts.en:
Jeannilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, etc. for her ready-to-wear business.

Jeannilyn has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Jeannilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Edmelinda

texts.en:
Edmelinda is 54 years old and married with ten children. With three children still in school, Edmelinda works very hard to provide for them.

Edmelinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years.  She sells a variety of items such as rice, noodles, canned goods, seasonings, cooking oil, etc. 

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, noodles, canned goods, seasonings, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Edmelinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, noodles, canned goods, seasonings, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Fahmeeda

texts.en:
Fahmeeda is a 43-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good; she has to think many times before starting any task.  

Her elder son newly started to drive a Chingchi rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike and body). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Her son has bought the motorbike but does not have money left to buy the body to make a Chingchi rickshaw. 

She requested a loan so that her son can buy a new rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly. She is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: St Theresa Girls Group

texts.en:
Cleo is a 65-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years, he has been in agriculture, and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land to expand his farming activities and also venture into produce sales. He also earns a salary as a civil servant.

Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes affect his profits. His dream is to venture into modern farming and set up a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round.

Cleo intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell. He is a member of the above mentioned group, where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun (in the photo), age 61, is a rice farmer and lives in a suburb of Phnom Pen. She has been married since 1979 and has four children. All of her children are in school. Her husband’s business is in buying, raising and selling cows.   

Thoeun is asking for a loan to help raise capital for her husband. Her husband will use the loan to buy an additional cow to raise and sell.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ibraham

texts.es:
El señor Ibraham de 36 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en su casa  de habitación ubicada en una  colonia al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace ya ocho años ala elaboración y venta de hamaca  de hilo, hamaca de seda, hamaca de cabuyas, y hamaca de cáñamo.
Don Ibraham  su negocio está ubicado a la orilla de la pavimentada que conduce hacia la capital de la república  son reconocido por su amabilidad con todas las personas que visitan su negocio.
Don Ibraham  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de cabuyas de seda, lasos y sondaleza para la elaboración de hamacas. Con el apoyo espera que sus ingresos aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer  a sus clientes. 
Don Ibraham  su sueño  es  tener un negocio más fuerte de la localidad.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Ibraham is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children in his house located in a neighborhood in the south of Honduras. For the past eight years he has been making hammocks out of cotton, silk, agave and hemp. Ibraham's business is located by the side of the highway that leads to the capital of the country. He is known for his friendliness with which he greets everyone who visits his business. 

Ibraham is requesting a loan to buy silk thread, straps and cord to make his hammocks. With this help he hopes that his revenues will increase as he will have more products to offer his clients. Ibraham's  dream is to have the best business in his area. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2013.

loans.use: to buy silk rope, straps and cord.

loans.name: Duena

texts.en:
Duena is 38 years old and married with four children.

Duena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like chips, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

Duena has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load and raising pigs.

Duena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like chips, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a 41-year-old married woman with eight children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emelda has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Emelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Veronica Esmeralda

texts.es: Verónica vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas  desde hace varios, comercializa de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, verónica está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales para seguir elaborando las  hamacas como: hilos de colores, lana, etc. ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Verónica lives in her own home with her family. She has earned a living making and selling hammocks for several years. She sells them as a street vender in the different neighborhoods near her place of residence. With her earnings she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Verónica is requesting a loan to purchase materials, such as colored threads, wool, etc., so she can continue making hammocks because this is her only source of work. Thus she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase colored thread, wool, etc.

loans.name: Vicente De Jesus

texts.es: Vicente vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de pepino desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia ya tiene clientela establecida que lo prefieren porque su producto es fresco, de calidad y a buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  Vicente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos que le generan buenas ganancias y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vicente lives in his own house with his wife and four children. He works in agriculture. For the past several years he has been growing cucumbers. He sells them in the different markets located close to his home. He has established clients who prefer him as his product is fresh, of good quality and fair-priced. What he makes from his income he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Vincent is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and manure to continue farming his crops They produce good returns which allows him to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay expenses that her family will incur, since her daughter will have oral surgery

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania tiene 32 años, es casada con Cirilo de 35 años y tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de material noble. Tania se dedica a la venta de lubricantes envasados para diversos vehículos. Desempeña su negocio en el primer piso de su vivienda y la idea partió puesto que en los alrededores de su vivienda existen muchos talleres para reparación de vehículos cuyos reparadores visitan su negocio ya que cuenta con una buena variedad de mercadería. Su esposo a la vez tanbien se dedica al rubro de reparación de vehículos y hace uso de los productos que vende logrando hacer de este un negocio muy familia. Le agrada su trabajo puesto que puede estar en su casa junto a sus hijos mientras apoya a su esposo en el camino de obtener una buena calidad de vida. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de lubricantes al por mayor para vehículos de diversos modelos.
texts.en: Tania is 32 years old. She is married to Cirilo, who is 35, and she has two children who live with her in her home, which is made of solid materials. Tania sells bottles of lubricants for various vehicles. She runs her business on the first floor of her home, and the idea [for it] arose from the fact that around her house there are many workshops for repairing vehicles. Their repairmen visit her business, since she has a good variety of merchandise. Her husband also works in the vehicle repair trade and makes use of the products that she sells, making this very much a family business. She enjoys her work because she can be at home with her children while she helps her husband on the path to obtaining a good quality of life. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she needs to continue forward. In addition, she promises to make her payments punctually. At this time she would like to have 2000 PEN for the wholesale purchase of lubricants for various model vehicles.

loans.use: to buy lubricants wholesale

loans.name: Sara Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Sara tiene 12 años de educación, es una mujer casada madre de 4 hijos que en compañía de su esposo se dedican a la agricultura especializándose en el cultivo de caña de azúcar posteriormente convirtiendo la materia prima en dulce de panela. Doña Sara se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 14 años lo cual aprendió en compañía de sus esposo teniendo una propiedad la cual fue comprada a un cliente para cultivo de caña. Ella también tiene una pequeña pulpería y una pequeña llantera en la cual se involucran sus hijos atendiendo a los diferentes viajantes que se trasladan de norte a sur y de este a oeste. Sus clientes para el dulce de panela son los diferentes supermercados de la zona, bodegas y mini súper ya que su producto es popular por la higiene y seguridad con loa que son elaborados. Como único desafió encontrado es el incremento de costos que conlleva el mantenimiento de las maquinas, la propiedad donde está ubicada la cañería y los ingredientes para elaborar el dulce ya que la competencia no es problema.  
Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento para poder comprar caña y poder cultivar una mayor cantidad de unidades ya que mediante a esto mejorar la cantidad de producto sembrado y al final lograr obtener una mayor cantidad de caña para elaborar dulce.
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder comprar más tierra y lograr sembrar la mayor cantidad de caña posible ya que de esa manera ella podrá satisfacer la demanda insatisfecha y generar mayores ingresos para poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus metas, sueños y planes a futuro.
texts.en:
Sara has 12 years of schooling. She is the married mother of 4 children, who along with her husband works in agriculture. They specialize in the cultivation of sugar cane which they then convert into raw material for making dulce de panela (a local sweet made out of cane sugar). Sara has been involved in this business for the past 14 years. She learned along with her husband who has a property which was bought from a client to grow sugar cane. She also has a small store and a small tire repair shop which involve her children with the different travelers going from north to south and east to west. 

Her clients for the dulce de panela are the various supermarkets, warehouses and convenience stores in the area. Her product is popular for it's cleanliness and quality with which it is made. The only problem is the increasing cost which maintaining the machinery and the property where the cane is grown entails and the raise in costs of the ingredients used. Their competition is no problem. 

What they need a loan at present is to buy cane to cultivate a greater quantity of units, as increasing the amount planted they will be able to harvest a greater amount of cane to make the dulce. Their future plans are to buy more land and be able to plant as much sugar cane as possible to try to keep up with the ever growing demand. They can generate more revenues and continue to support their children in their goals, plans and dreams for the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane in order to grow it.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang (in the photo), age 51, stays at home and does housework. She lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has three children--two sons and one daughter. Two are in school and the other one is still young. 

The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

Samnang is applying for a loan to add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to school.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to school.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa de 28 años de edad, esta casada y vive en su propia casa  de habitación junto a su esposo  en un municipio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras. Se dedica desde hace más de 5 años al negocio que es la venta de Hamacas de hilo, hamacas de seda, hamacas de lazo, de todos los tipos y tamaños.
Doña Rosa sus ventas son diarias de lunes a domingo en su negocio, sus clientes son las personas que viajan hacia la capital de Honduras ya que su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la orilla de la pavimentada que conduce hacia la capital de la república.
Doña Rosa esta  Solicita el préstamo  para la compra de materiales como hilos, sondalezas, tijeras, cabuyas de seda, etc. para la elaboración de hamacas y así surtir más su negocio. Con el apoyo del préstamo y la inversión que realiza a su negocio espera que sus ventas aumenten y por ende mejorar sus ingresos, su deseo es seguir trabajando con Prisma. 
Doña Rosa su sueño es que se le mejoren las ventas y tener buenos clientes que le sean puntuales. 

San Lorenzo,  Honduras - Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is 28 years old. She is married and lives in her own home, together with her husband, in the town of San Lorenzo, in the southern zone of Honduras. She has worked for more than five years in her business, which is selling thread hammocks, silk hammocks, and rope hammocks, of all types and sizes.

In her business, Doña Rosa's sales are made from Monday to Sunday. Her customers are people who travel to the capital of Honduras, since her business is located on the edge of the paved road that leads to the capital of the republic.

Doña Rosa is applying for the loan to buy materials such as threads, plastic cord, scissors, colored silk ropes, etc., to make hammocks and thus stock her business more. With the support of the loan and the investment that she makes in her business, she expects her sales to grow and therefore improve her income. Her wish is to continue working with Prisma.

Doña Rosa's dream is that her sales will improve and that she will have good customers who are punctual.

San Lorenzo,  Honduras - October, 2013

loans.use: to buy thread, plastic cord, scissors, colored silk rope, etc., for her business

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan (in the photo), age 41, is a security guard, and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. He has been married since 1993 and has four children - two sons and two daughters. One is a garment worker, another one is an auto-repairman and the other two are still young. 
His wife is a garment worker. Phan is asking for a loan to expand the house where he lives by adding front porches.

loans.use: To expand the house where he lives by adding front porches.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. Islam is a 21-year-old married woman from Deir el Balah city. She lives with her husband in a simple house in the city. For the past two years, Islam's husband has been working in a small grocery store he owns. It is a good project and earns a good income. 
Islam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more grocery products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Islam and her husband will be able to develop their store and also their income.

loans.use: to buy more products for her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is a 35-year-old married woman and a member of a three-person lending group. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband owns a small artificial jewellery shop, the only source of income for his family. He sell varieties of artificial jewellery, including bangles, necklaces, earrings, and rings in the shop. 

Uzma is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase artificial bangles and necklaces. Uzma hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of jewellery for her husband to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 21-year-old single man from Deir El Balah city. He lives with his family in a very simple house in the city. Alaa has been working in computer maintenance and extending internet networks for a few years. He took the experience from his previous job and now he is working in his own shop. This is the only source of income for the family.
Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw materials to meet the demand of extending internet networks. This will increase his income and will improve the family living conditions. 
Alaa appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to meet the demand of extending internet networks

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma is widowed and engages in a retailing business. At the age of 60 she runs her retail store business for many years to save for the future. According to her, she did not want to rely only on her children's support that’s why even though she is getting older, she keeps on working. 
Ledesma is selling a variety of grocery items in their village. She wanted to extend the products she sells to her customers that are seldom available in their village. Ledesma is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy beverages, powdered milk, diapers, toothbrushes and other items. She still hopes to earn higher income and grow her business despite of her age.

loans.use: to buy beverages, powdered milk, diapers, toothbrushes and other items.

loans.name: Floriza

texts.en:
To live a decent life and someday to have a better future--that is why Floriza is working hard, together with her husband, in their farming labor jobs, and she patiently manages her hog-raising business, too. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional capital for the feed maintenance of the hogs she raises. 

She is 38 years old and she has one child who already attends school. Her family is happily living in the province of Isabela. Despite life's difficulties, they hardily do their best to continue support the studies of their child to someday have a good future.

loans.use: as additional capital for the feed maintenance of the hogs she raises.

loans.name: Leonca

texts.en:
Leonca  is applying for a loan of $ 600.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 29 years old. She is married and she has two children.

She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as  cigarettes, noodles, salt, sugar, coffee, eggs, slippers, milk, oils, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, and rice. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Leonca is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, noodles, salt, sugar, coffee, eggs, slippers, milk, oils, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, and rice

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 44 years old, married and the mother of seven children. With five children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them and pay their school fees by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, chips, eggs and spices. She has been in her current line of work for two years and her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, chips, eggs and spices.

loans.name: Nashat

texts.en: Nashat is 31 years old, married and lives in the city of Rafah. He has three sons, all of whom attend school. He is employed in the public sector, where he earns a very low wage which barely covers the family's needs. For the past six years, Nashat has also worked in fishing, because the income from this job supports family needs and covers part of the family's expenses. He is requesting a loan from FATEN to buy raw materials to make new nets for fishing. This will help him increase his income. We see Nashat in the photo, which was taken while he was working.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a new net for fishing

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Mercy has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from buying and selling live fish.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell. He is an ambitious man who trades in agricultural produce in the district of Hoima, Uganda.

The high cost of transport and unpredictable weather changes affect his business growth while his desire is to set up a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round. His personal goals are to build a permanent house for residence and to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en: Srey Touch (who we see in the photo), is 28 years old and a garment worker who lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. She has three daughters — two who attend school and another who is too young to enroll. Her husband is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, these vehicles were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities. Srey Touch is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for commuting to work because she does not have her own transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Sovy

texts.en: Sovy (who we see in the photo) is 26 years old and a garment worker. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh and has one young daughter. Her husband is also a garment worker. She is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for commuting to work because she does not have her own transportation and often has to travel with her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Remelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Remelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of recycled materials for her business of buying and selling recycled materials.

Remelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of recycled materials

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is married and works hard to support her family by running a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other fishing materials. She has been in this business for nine years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.ru: Нарзулло умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он родился в 1994 года. Он является студентом 2 курса Национального Университета Таджикистана. Он учится по специальности юриста. Нарзулло читает много книг и старается получить максимум знаний. После окончания университета он хочет работать в сфере суда. Нарзулло не имеет источника дохода. Его родители тоже не в состоянии оплатить за его учебный договор в этом году. Нарзулло запрашивает займ на сумму 1800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Narzullo is a bright, hard-working young man.  He was born in 1994, and is a sophomore studying law at the National University of Tajikistan.  Narzullo is an avid reader and is always trying to bolster his knowledge.  After he graduates, he hopes to find work in the judicial system.  

At the moment, Narzullo has no source of income, and his parents cannot afford to pay his tuition this year; to pay for his schooling, he is seeking a loan of $1,800 (USD), and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay for his education

loans.name: Afzalsho

texts.ru: Афзалшо 18 лет. Он в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Экономический Университет Таджикистана. Афзалшо уже несколько месяцев является студентом. Он учится по специальности Финансы и кредит. Ему нравится быть студентом. Афзалшо со школьной скамьи отлично учил математику и поэтому ему не трудно учить экономические предметы. Афзалшо учится в очное отделение по договорной основе. Он часто посещает библиотеку, а также в свободное время занимается спортом. Он запрашивает займ с целью того, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Afzalsho is 18 years old.  He finished secondary school earlier this year, and is currently enrolled at a Tajikistani university specializing in economics where he's been a finance major for the past few months. He thoroughly enjoys being a student, and is getting along rather well with his studies; he's been an ace at math since hе was a young schoolboy, so studying finance has been a breeze for him.  Apart from his studies, he frequents the campus library, and plays sports in his free time.  Afzalsho is taking classes on the campus in person, and paying tuition out of pocket.  He is seeking a loan to be able to pay for his studies, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay for his university education

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, está casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos no tiene ayuda del extranjero, de su familia aprendió el oficio de cultivo de granos básicos, hace seis años lo ejerce de forma independiente, al momento no le ha representado ningún problema está actividad.
Invertirá en compra de semilla, abono, herbicidas e insecticidas también pagara a las personas que le ayuden a preparar la tierra y así sembrar sin ningún problema, los resultados serán mayor productividad, granos de calidad y mejores ganancias con las que cancelara su deuda.
Sueña con reparar su vivienda, dar a su familia mejor alimentación, salud, y educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is married and lives with his wife and two children. He doesn't have any outside help. He learned to grow bulk grains from his family, and has been doing this independently for six years now. This activity has not caused him any problems to date.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of seeds, manure, herbicides and insecticides. He will also pay the people who help him to prepare the land, which will allow him to go about planting with no problems. The results will be greater productivity, quality grains, and better earnings, with which he will pay off the loan.

Juan dreams of repairing his home, providing his family with better food and health, and giving his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 54-year-old woman and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. She requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan of amount 25,000 PKR. 
She wants the financing to invest in buying supplies/accessories such as cell phone batteries, chargers, casings, head phones, and cell phone bags for her husband’s cell phone accessories shop. As this shop is the only source of income for their family, she wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy. 
Her husband is very experienced and professional in his dealings and has been operating his business for the past four years. Kaneez is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and bring positive changes in the life of their family.

loans.use: To pay for mobile accessories.

loans.name: Sokmean

texts.en:
Sokmean (in the photo) is 32 years old and lives about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has been married since 2003 and has just one young son. His wife is a garment worker.    
Sokmean’s business is in renting out musical instrument sets (in Khmer it's Ork Kes) such as microphones, speakers, guitars, or drums. People prefer to rent Ork Kes to entertain at religious ceremonies and weddings.    
Sokmean is applying for a loan to buy four more speakers.

loans.use: To buy four more speakers.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming banana/coconut in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Anita has been farming banana/coconut for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zulieta

texts.en:
Zulieta is 39 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Zulieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Zulieta requested a 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Zulieta has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zulieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 
She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, and eggs for her restaurant business.
Erlinda has been in this business for six years. Erlinda earns more income from raising livestock.
Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, and eggs

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is already 37 years old. She is married and has four children who all attend school. Her husband is a farmer. They live peacefully in the village of Antagan. 

She maintains a hog-raising business as another source of income. Every three to four months, she usually sells her fattened pigs, after which, she will again buy four piglets to raise and sell when they are fully grown up. Her earnings from the business went toward paying the tuition fees of her children in school. 

Genevieve is doing her best with her husband in farming to get ahead in life and be able to support the education of all their children. To further improve her hog-raising, she wanted to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] that will be helpful to her in buying sufficient supply of hog feed and medicines needed by her raised pigs.

loans.use: to buy sufficient supply of hog feed and medicines for the pigs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Arlene is borrowing 30,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a 14,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc., to sell in her general store.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years now.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aslibegim

texts.ru: Аслибегим имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она в течение многих лет работала в средней школе. Она последние годы работает в парикмахерской, так как в школе она имела маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватала для обеспечения ее сына. Она единственная кормилица своего сына, так ее муж погиб в гражданской войне. Аслибегим старается обеспечить своего сына со всеми не обходимыми средствами и дать высшее образование. Ее сын учится в университете, и она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она надеется на ваше милосердие и надеется, что этот займ поможет ее сироте получить образование.
texts.en:
Aslibegim has a degree in education.  For many years she worked in a secondary school.  However, for the past few years, she has been working in a beauty salon because her teacher's salary was not enough to provide for her son.   Aslibegim's husband died during the civil war, so she is now the only breadwinner for her son.

Aslibegim tries to provide her son with all the necessities of life and wants to give him a higher education.  Her son is currently a university student, and she needs to pay his tuition fees.  She is taking a loan of $1,000 for this purpose.  She is relying on your generosity and hopes that this loan will help her fatherless son to get an education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung (in the photo) raises pigs at home. She is 45 years old and lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one son and three daughters. Her son is married and lives separately; two of her daughters attend high school, and another is in university in Phnom Penh and works as well. 
Her husband is a fisherman. Soung is applying for a loan in order to buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to university and work. Her daughter rides a bicycle and riding a bicycle is tiring and takes lots of time.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to school and work.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is taking a loan of $1,200 to increase the inventory of her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs and fish. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Martina is a hard working woman and she hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs and fish

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 32 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gena has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from rice sales. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is single with 1 child. She is 51 years old and lives in Tinacla-an,Clarin, Philippines.
Norma sells snacks in the local community to earn a living and has been operating this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as margarine, sugar, flour, egg, milk, oil, cheese, butter, cocoa powder, etc.
Norma has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Norma hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as margarine, sugar, flour, egg, milk, oil, cheese, butter, cocoa powder, etc.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 30 year old married woman with 2 children.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's cotton factory. 
Her husband has been a cotton factory owner for 2 years. He always fulfills his job efficiently and tries to provide the best quality of work to his clients.
With the loan, Iram will help her husband to purchase more cotton to offer better quality services to his clients. He has great bargaining skills, and his clients are very pleased with his services. 
Iram's personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home. She is hopeful that the loan will bring a considerable growth to their monthly income through increased profits.

loans.use: to pay for cotton.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es: Yohana tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de un niño de un año y vive junto a sus padres en su vivienda hecha de material noble que construyó con el apoyo de su familia. Tras su separación conyugal optó por poner un negocio dedicado a la venta diversos productos comestibles y para la casa los cuales tienen buena demanda en su localidad, además le agrada vender productos acordes  a fechas festivas ya que ameritan la compra de estos por los habitantes de la localidad donde vive.  Muy aparte de su negocio posee una maquina surtidora de refrescos con el que expende bebidas preparadas a base de maracuyá y maíz,Desea contar con dinero para seguir surtiendo su negocio con mercadería al por mayor para obtener ingresos extras.Sus objetivos a largo plazo esta en iniciar la construcción del tercer piso de su vivienda para así convertirlo a futuro en una casa para el alquiler de cuartos de vivienda y generar ingresos fijos en beneficio de su economía familiar. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con  2,000 nuevos soles e invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor como productos de limpieza entre  jabones, escobillas, detergentes y accesorios menores para el hogar.
texts.en:
Yohana is 34 years old. She is a single mother of a one-year-old son, and she lives with her parents in their house made of fine material that she built with the support of her family. 

After her marriage ended, she decided to start a business dedicated to selling various food and household products, which are in high demand in her area. Additionally, she is happy to sell products coinciding with holiday dates that merit the purchase of these products by residents of the town where she lives.
