He has been able to attract his clients because he makes all types of delicious foods and tasty juices. He wants to acquire more products with which he can grow his business in order to achieve his objective, so he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy food items such as beans, sugar, cheese, eggs and fruits. Fares appears in the photo and his customer is seen sitting down behind him.

loans.use: to buy food items such as beans, sugar, cheese, eggs and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Hong was born in 1974. She raises pigs. She lives with her family in Bac Ninh. She has two children who are in secondary and high school. Her husband is a driver. She has raised pigs for a living for 10 years. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She also retails scrap to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to raise pigs and lacking money to pay for her children’s education. Her dreams are to expand her business and help her children be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. Hong is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She also has passion in her business because she can work at home and have time to take care of her children. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy pigs for raising. She always wants to expand her business, improve her family’s life and save profits for her children's education.

Other members who are part of Hong’s group include the following:

Le is 32 years old. She has two children. She is a pork seller. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to sell pork. 

Men is 31 years old. She has two children. She produces tofu and raises pigs for a living. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy materials to produce tofu and buy pigs for raising.

loans.use: to buy pigs for raising.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 50 years old and married. She is in the business of sewing clothes, which she has been doing for many years. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers Parveen is requesting her third loan for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of buttons, zippers, and needles.  The loan will help her to stitch up more dresses in less time.

loans.use: to purchase threads in different colors, packs of buttons, zippers, and needles.

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 60-year-old widowed man with two children. His daughter is married and lives separate from them. His son is married also and lives with Karam. 

Karam has been a farmer for 22 years raising, buying, and selling livestock. He plans to build a little house for his son's family in the future. 

Karam will use the funds from this loan to pay for personal medical expenses as he has health problems.

loans.use: to pay for personal medical expenses.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 33-year–old married man.Together with his  wife he is raising 2 kids. Ilham is an IDP person (internally displaced person). He moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with his family. 

His primary income sources are sales from milk and eggs. He has been doing this work for 7 years. His parents taught him how to care for and feed cows. Before getting married, he worked with his parents in a barnyard. Now he can works with livestock on his own. 

Ilham is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN for the first time in order to renovate the barn. This loan will help him a lot. Without this help, he would not be able to assist and contribute to his family. 

In the future, he hopes to improve the living conditions of his family and is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to renovate the barn.

loans.name: Syeda Mahmooda

texts.en:
Syeda Mahmooda had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Six years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and she uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is the mother of three children; all are school-going. 

Syeda Mahmooda requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors, along with packs of buttons and needles. With this loan, she would be able to meet the demands of her customers, without fail. 

Syeda Mahmooda hopes to grow her business and she dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors, along with packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She sells salt, which she has been doing for four years. She earns additional money through farming. She ventured into business in order to raise money to support her husband whose income could not sustain the family. Prolonged rains, which affect the supply of salt from the lake, and inadequate capital are her major challenges.

Jovia is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy salt to sell.  She hopes to start a salt processing plant in the furture.

loans.use: to purchase salt

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. 

Rani has been working with hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. Her daughter also helps her in completing the orders of her customers on time. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan  is a 33-year-old man, married, with two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

He breeds sheep and cattle, and in addition, sells milk products and meat. Sanan has more than seven years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best way to look after cattle. 

Sanan usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in three to six months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Milk and yogurt, he sells to his neighbors. Selling milk and meat brings in 150 AZN in income per month. Milk and yogurt are very popular products in Azerbaijan, as are beef and mutton. People use meat in everyday national dishes like pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt. Milk products are considered very healthy, and they are also present in everyday life. 

There is only one income in Sanan's family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. 

Sanan applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase six sheep, one cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep, one cow, and fodder.

loans.name: Karen Estefany

texts.es:
Karen, está soltera, vive con su madre,  es una joven que a su corta edad de 18 años ya empieza a luchar para generar ingresos para apoyar en los gastos de su casa, tiene una venta de pupusas, tostadas y pasteles de carne, dicha actividad la desempeña todos los días junto a su mamá. Para ella es una actividad que no le representa problemas pues conoce muy bien el procedimiento.
Con la inversión ella comprara harina, gas, plátanos, quesillo, etc., que son su materia prima para el negocio, con esto ella espera trabajar sin algún problema para generar los ingresos que tanto necesita y los utilizara en mejorar su situación familiar y pagar el préstamo.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para que su rentabilidad sea mejor y así no pasar necesidades como las que ahora tiene.
texts.en:
Karen is single and lives with her mother.  She is a young woman who, at the young age of 18 years, is already starting to struggle to earn an income to help with household expenses.  She has a small shop to sell pupusas, tostadas and meat pies.  She works in this business everyday with her mother.  For her, this is a business that does not present problems, because she knows the procedure very well.

With the investment, she will buy flour, gas, plantains, cheese, etc., that are the ingredients for her business.  With this, she hopes to work without problems to generate the income that she needs so much.  She will use the income to improve her family situation and to repay the loan.

Her dream is to expand her business to improve its profitability and not to want for anything.

loans.use: to buy flour, gas, plantains and cheese.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 55-year-old, married woman. She is very talented and she excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She, together with her husband, manages their household, while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Zahida has now requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Zahida hopes to grow her business and she dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members, through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Xayyam

texts.en:
Xayyam is 37 years old. For the past 12 years, he has been a farmer who has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. Xayyam chose to become a farmer because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. He sells his crops in the central bazaar and his monthly income is 140 AZN. Xayyam has gained enough skills and experience to run his business. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and also are used to make a fresh punch. 

Xayyam is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizer. This will be his first loan. Xayyam wants to produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 46 years old and married with three children ages 17, 19, and 23. For the past six years, he has worked as a taxi driver transporting people along different routes. This is Rovshan’s only source of income. Currently, his car is broken and urgently needs to be repaired. Rovshan does not have the money to repair his automobile. 

Rovshan is requesting a loan to buy car repair parts and return to work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his car and return to work

loans.name: Fahmeeda

texts.en:
Fahmeeda is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of six children. A driver by profession, her husband has been providing transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses.

Fahmeeda has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 so that her husband can buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better service to his passengers. Fahmeeda is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one that will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy new tires for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia tiene 46 años de edad y es una mujer muy emprendedora, honesta, trabajadora y luchadora ya que desde muy temprano por la mañana ella se levanta para cumplir con sus compromisos hogareños y del campo. Ella es casada y en compañía de su esposo y sus cuatro hijos se dedican al cultivo de café, maíz y frijol dividiéndose las diferente actividades a realizar para de esa manera involucrase todos como familia y valorar lo que con sacrificio y esfuerzo construyen. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que trabaja la tierra hace muchos años gracias a sus padres que fueron quienes le enseñaron y heredaron la tierra que hoy en día trabaja con su familia la cual está ubicada a 30 minutos de camino desde su casa de habitación.
Doña Alicia ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL financiamiento para fortalecer sus cultivos de café con el cual comprara abono, foliares, urea, formula cafetalera para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos mejorando la calidad del producto y también el volumen de cosecha que por consiguiente mejorara el bienestar de su familia.
Doña Alicia tiene la esperanza de dar una mejor, mayor y excelente apariencia a sus cultivos de café haciendo de ellos un producto más atractivo para sus clientes ya que ella sueña con mejorar la condición de vida de su familia ofreciendo la oportunidad a sus hijos para que se puedan preparar académicamente y puedan con conocimiento formar sus propias micro empresas y ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
Doña Alicia is 46 years old and is a very enterprising, honest, hardworking and determined woman.  She gets up very early in the morning to be able to fulfill her commitments at home and in the field.  She is married, and she, her husband and four children make their living growing coffee, corn and beans. They divide themselves among the different activities so that they are all involved as a family and appreciate what they can build with sacrifice and effort.

She has a lot of experience because she has been working the land for many years, thanks to her parents who were the ones who taught her and gave her the land which she works today with her family.  The land is located 30 minutes from her house.  

Alicia has applied to the cooperative COMIXMUL for a loan to strengthen her coffee crops.  With the loan she will buy compost, foliar fertilizers, urea, and coffee formula to maintain her crops, improve the quality of the product and also the volume of the harvest, which will consequently improve the wellbeing of her family.

Alicia hopes to give a better, greater and excellent appearance to her coffee crops, making them a more attractive product for her customers.  She dreams of better living conditions for her family -- offering her children the opportunity to become educated and so that they can form their own micro-enterprises knowledgeably and be good people.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina tiene 43 años, es casada con Julio y tiene 2 hijos. Posee una vivienda hecha de material noble que construyó con el fruto de muchos años de trabajo y donde vive junto a su querida familia. Posee un terreno de cultivo en una comunidad muy cercana con plantaciones de cacao, café, palillo; entre otros.
Al tener la responsabilidad de estar al pendiente de sus hijos que son menores no puede realizar personalmente las tareas cotidianas en el campo y viene obteniendo los ingresos correspondientes con el apoyo de trabajadores que contrata. Para el correcto manejo de sus terrenos agrícolas debe contar con dinero que le permite hacer efectiva la compra de insumos tales como abono orgánico, herramientas y pago a los tranajadores que siempre es necesario puesto que las plantaciones que posee necesitan un manteniendo que se debe hacer de manera colectiva.
Este es su primer préstamoc con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para seguir invirtiendo en sus terrenos con la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Corina is 43 years old. She is married to Julio and has two children. She owns a house, which she was able to build out of quality materials thanks to many years of hard work. She lives there with her beloved family. She owns a plot of land in a nearby community where she grows cacao, coffee, turmeric, and other crops. 

Since she is responsible for the care of her young children, she can't personally carry out the daily farming chores, and keeps her business running by hiring workers. In order to adequately manage her farmland she needs to have enough money to allow her to purchase supplies, such as organic fertilizer and tools. She also needs to be able to pay the workers, which are always needed because the crops need maintenance requiring a collective effort.

This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to keep going. She also promises to pay her installments on time.

At this time she would like to have 1,000 nuevos soles to continue investing in her land by purchasing organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 41 years old and married. For many years, she has been selling milk.  Rukhsana has two buffaloes and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after her buffalos and collects milk on daily basis. Rukhsana makes enough through her business to contribute to her family’s income. 

Rukhsana is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan to buy one more buffalo to provide milk for more customers and make huge profits. She hopes to increase her milk production capacity which ultimately helps her to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Petre

texts.en:
Petre, who lives in Nanyuki Kenya, is a 40-year-old married father of two children. A farmer for 12 years now, Petre's business has improved over the years, and he has been able to employ one person to help him run the farm. His major challenge is unpredictable weather.

Petre learned of Milango through friends who invited him to join for the purpose of saving and being able to access credit. He now seeks a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm and will use the resulting improved income to raise his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: La señora Delfina, tiene 49 años, convivía su esposo hace algunos años sin embargo el decidió irse a otra ciudad para tener otra pareja y formar su familia, dejo a la señora Delfina  con tres hijos de los cuales uno es independiente  y dos son dependientes que se encuentran estudiando en el nivel primario de un colegio ubicado por la zona donde ella vive, la señora Delfina  tiene su vivienda en la comunidad de Sacaba, es comerciante en la misma zona, trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm y el resto del tiempo lo pasa con sus dos hijos. El credito que solicita es para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que cuando se fue el padre de sus hijos no termino la obra fina de parte de la vivienda por lo que la señora Delfina decidió mejorarlo para que sus hijos tengan comodidad con sus propias habitaciones.
texts.en: Delfina is 49 years old. She lived with her husband up until a few years ago; however, he decided to go to another city to start a family with another partner.  He left Delfina with three children, of whom one is independent and two are dependent, attending a primary school located in the area where she lives. Delfina has her home in the community of Sacaba. She is a merchant in the same area. She works from Monday through Saturday, from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., and she spends the rest of her time with her two children. The loan she is requesting is to improve her home, since when the father of her children left, the finishing work had not been completed on part of the home. Therefore, Delfina decided to improve it so that her children will have comfort in their own rooms.

loans.use: to improve her home (finishing rooms for her children).

loans.name: Breera

texts.en:
Breera is a 25-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Breera is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

Breera is requesting 30,000 PKR loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She wants to grow her business and is expecting boost in her earnings. In the future, Breera dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 30 years old and married with two children between the ages of five and 12. Soon after she got married, she began a business selling palm oil in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Mariama started this business to improve her life and family. She says that at present her business is doing well. Mariama has been able to take care of her family with her profit. 

Mariama is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. In the future, Mariama would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to sell

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir is 41 years old, married, and a father of three children. Shakir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants, and other vegetables and fruits. Shakir says even though this business is very hard, he and his wife have been handling the business for 10 years without any difficulty. 

He grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as getting more land for cultivation. He is looking forward to increased sales in the coming autumn because people purchase fruit a lot. Now he needs a loan of 1,900 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married and has three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has practiced farming, growing various crops such as vegetables and tomatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Beside farming, she also sells bricks.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticide

loans.name: Majin

texts.es: Don Majin tiene 38 años de edad, es de una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos por lo tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas, vive en la comunidad de Mizque, trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria desde hace 20 años produce cebolla, papa y frejol para la alimentación de su familia y el excedente los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciante de la misma población de Mizque. Don Majin una persona muy respetado en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos, Don Majin está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas abonos y agroquímicos, para mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Majin is 38 years old and he comes from a very humble family with few economic resources. He lives in Mizque and has worked in agriculture for the past 20 years.  He grows onions, potatoes, and beans so that he can feed his family, and he sells all the extras to people in the region. 

Majin is highly respected in his community because of his dedication to his work, because he is responsible with his crops, and because he works hard to provide an education for his children.  Majin is seeking a loan so that he can buy seeds, fertilizers, and other agricultural chemicals in order to improve the quality of his crops and increase production.  By doing this, he will increase his income and be able to improve the living conditions of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo en una zona rural de Mocupe, un distrito donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la actividad de venta de prendas de vestir y calzado, además de artículos de cocina, y plásticos, desde hace más de 10 años, Carmen Rosa, es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para incrementar su negocio con la compra de polos, pantalones, camisas para niños y ofrecerlos a sus clientes, aprovechando el cambio de clima por la temporada de primavera- verano.

Ella dice que con el crédito que le ofrezca Edpyme Alternativa, podrá generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 54 years old. She lives together with her husband and one child in a rural area of Mocupe, a district where the inhabitants dedicate themselves to agriculture and trade. The area is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru. 

Together with her family, she dedicates herself to the work of selling clothing and shoes, as well as kitchen items and plastic goods. She has done this work for more than 10 years. Carmen Rosa is an enterprising woman, and she has requested a loan of 2,000 new Peruvian soles to expand her business by purchasing polo shirts, pants and children's shirts to offer to her customers, taking advantage of the change in weather for the spring-summer season. 

She says that with the loan offered to her by Edpyme Alternativa, she will be able to generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 38 years old and lives in Kongowea, north of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married man with three children. He is a carpenter by training. He owns a small carpentry shop that has been in existence for the last five years. This business is what has been feeding his family. He knew Milango through friends who asked him to join them. He agreed for the purpose of saving and being able to access credit for his business. He now seeks a loan to buy timber for his shop. He has ambitions that his business will grow into a renowned business over the next five years. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living and also educate his children.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña María de Jesús es una mujer de 50 años de edad, acompañada (en unión libre) y madre de 2 hijos los cuales ayudan a sus padres con la limpieza, aplicación de abono y recolección de café. Desde niña aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que en su familia la agricultura es una tradición adquiriendo el conocimiento por medio de sus padres quienes también son agricultores especializándose en el cultivo de café y granos básicos. En compañía de su esposo y 2 de los hijos trabajan diariamente para que sus cultivos sean los mejores de la zona y los más provechosos manteniendo sus cultivos sanos y protegidos de bichos y enfermedades como la roya. La tierra que en familia trabajan está ubicada a 100 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación la cual fue heredada por sus padres y la otra pequeña parte a 30 minutos la cual fue adquirida por medio de una compra a un cliente trasladándose a pie diariamente.
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder seguir ampliando más su tierra, seguir fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos heredando a cada uno de ellos una parcela de tierra para que puedan construir sus hogares o seguir con la agricultura ya que de esa manera ellos fortalecerán la economía de sus familias, construirán un techo digno para sus hijos y nietos. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos de café como abono, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes para dar asistencia a los mismos.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is a 50-year-old woman who has a partner (in a common-law marriage) and is the mother of 2 children who help their parents wtih the weeding, fertilizing and coffee harvesting. Since she was a girl, she learned to work the land, since farming is a tradition in her family. She acquired the knowledge from her parents, who are also farmers, specializing in growing coffee and basic grains. In the company of her husband and two children, she works every day so that their crops will be the best and most abundant.in the area, keeping the plants healthy and protecting them from pests and diseases such as coffee rust. The land that the family works is located 100 meters from their house, which was inherited from her parents, and there is also another small plot 30 minutes away, which was acquired through purchase from a customer coming by on foot each day. 

Her plans for the future are to keep expanding the family's land and strengthen their heritage so that their children will each inherit a parcel of land where they can build their houses or continue with farming. In this way, they will strengthen their families' economic situation and put an adequate roof over the heads of their children and grandchildren. For this reason, she is currently requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plantings, such as compost, fertilizer and a special formula for coffee plants, to give support to the plants.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to support her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Ma Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Me llamo Trinidad, tengo 63 años, soy casada y tengo 7 hijos; de los cuales ya ninguno depende mí. Me dedico al comercio desde hace 6 años, antes me daba pena vender pero una vecina me impulso a intentar prestándome mercancía. Así pude descubrir que sí me gustaba el comercio y tengo suerte para vender.
 
A mis clientes les vendo sábanas, edredones, colchas, toallas, ropa interior, bisutería, mayones, juguetes y bolsas para dama.  Pido este préstamo para comprar mercancía que necesito para cumplir lo que me están pidiendo mis clientes; por la época, necesito comprar principalmente ropa interior, calcetas, calcetines, pantaletas y juguetes. 

Gracias al esfuerzo que pongo en mi negocio he logrado ampliar y mejorar mi casa, ampliar mi negocio y gozar de una estabilidad y tranquilidad económica.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a client of Kubo Financiero, and here is her story:

"My name is Trinidad.  I am 63 years old and married.  I have seven children, none of whom are dependent upon me.  I have been a merchant for six years.  Before, I was timid about selling.  However, a neighbor motivated me to try by lending me merchandise.  That is how I was able to discover that, yes, I liked selling, and that I have luck when it comes to selling.

I sell my customers sheets, quilts, comforters, towels, underwear, costume jewelry, ponchos, toys, and women’s purses.  I am asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise that I need to fill the orders that my customers are making.  For the season I need to mainly buy underwear, leggings, socks, panties, and toys.

Thanks to the effort I put into my business, I have managed to expand and improve my house, expand my business, and enjoy financial stability and peace of mind."

loans.use: to stock merchandise and to cover customer orders.

loans.name: Gie Tannef Wande Group

texts.fr:
Tannef de Wande est un GIE qui évolue dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Il regroupe plus d’une centaine de personnes habitants dans un village situé à des centaines de kilomètres de la ville.
Le GIE Tannef de Wande, vient solliciter pour la première fois un crédit pour l’acquisition d’un terrain nu. Ils vont recevoir l’appui d’un bailleur qui veut bien prendre en charge la construction d’une unité de production de transformation de céréales locales si le GIE a déjà une parcelle disponible. Le groupe dispose de sept machines prêtes a l’emploi, moulin a mil, machine pour  faire cuire l’arachide et une autre pour la transformer en pâte, machine pour réduire le mil en poudre en vue d’en faire du couscous.
Le GIE qui compte plus d’une centaine de membres est ici représenté sur la photo par le bureau, la présidente qui se trouve a gauche, le trésorier et la secrétaire. 
C’est grâce aux bénéfices acquis, qu’il réussi à augmenter son stock de machines et a penser a initier d’autres activités parallèles qui peuvent générées un profit.
texts.en:
The Tannef of Wande is an Environmental Integrity Group (GIE) that is evolving in the field of agriculture. It includes more than a hundred people living in a village located several hundred kilometers from the city.

The GIE Tannef of Wande is requesting their first loan in order to purchase bare land. They will be supported by a donor who would like to take over the construction of a processing unit for local grain, as long as the GIE already has a parcel of land available. The group has seven machines available for use, including a mill for millet, a machine to roast peanuts and another to turn it into paste, plus a machine to reduce millet into the powder needed to make couscous.

The GIE that has over a hundred members is represented here in the photo by the officers; the president is shown on the far left, along with the treasurer and secretary. This is thanks to this loan, the group will be able to increase their stock of machinery and think about initiating other parallel businesses that will generate income.

loans.use: to purchase bare land where they will construct a processing unit for local grain.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence, aged 23, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child and his wife. He hires out tents and is also involved in a motorcycle transport business and decoration services. The high cost of operation and customers' not paying on time are his major challenges, while his dream is to own an events management company. Lawrence intends to use the loan to buy tents to hire out.

loans.use: to buy tents to hire out.

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz is 54 year of age. He is married and he has one son. Eyvaz is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. 

Eyvaz has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years. He is very hard working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Eyvaz’s income from this business is 130 AZN. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, Eyvaz plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his son will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1,800 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 37 years old and married with one child, who is 11 years old. Peter is a farmer who grows tomatoes at Mpeketoni. He has been in this business for two years now.He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and is taking out his fourth loan from KADET of 30,000 KES. He intends to use the loan to buy tomato seedlings and chemicals. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are for his future business to buy livestock and also to educate his child.

loans.use: To buy tomato seedlings and chemicals to expand his business.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 27 years old and he lives in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region of Armenia. He lives here with his wife, newborn baby, mother, and sister. His elder sister is married and lives with her family. Arman’s father died unexpectedly. After such great loss in their family, Arman became the only breadwinner. For the past two years, he has had his own business selling fruits and vegetables. In a rented stall he sells beans, potato, onions, mushrooms, peppers, carrots, eggplants, oranges, peaches, apples, pomegranates, lemons, and more. He has a lot of customers who like his stall for the fresh, tasty, and colorful vegetables and fruits. He buys the products for his stall from the local wholesale markets once a week.

Arman asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 37 years old and married, with two children between the ages of 11 and 16 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living and has been in this business since just after she got married.

Aminata sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because from the profit she is able to take care of her family.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and rental bills has her major monthly expenses.

Anastacia has operated a beauty salon business for the past three months. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants wants to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos. She joined Yehu because of favorable lending requirements

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single woman with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rose has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 30 years old and married with two children between the ages of one and ten. Her husband is a fisherman while Isatu runs a fish business in Tombo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She has been in this business since just after she got married. She sells fish within her community. She says that a major problem for her business is scarcity of fish due to weather conditions sometimes.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and enable her to become a successful businesswoman. In the future, she would like to build a fishing boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald lives in the Kongowea area, north of Mombasa, Kenya. He is 32 years old and a businessman. He has been operating a business renting plastic chairs for the last three years, and the business has been doing great. He now has ambitions of adding more chairs so that he can serve a greater nmumber of customers, especially during this festive season. He knew Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy plastic chairs for his business. He hopes that in the next five years he will be also renting a public address system. The challenges in the business are theft and that there is no insurance when the chairs are broken. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu. She is in her late 40s and is from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has six children. She began her business because she wants to be independent and to educate her children. For the past 16 years, Isatu has operated her retail business.  She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the difficulty of moving door-to-door to introduce her business.  

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kaklik

texts.en:
Kaklik is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children. Kaklik is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP  Settlement .For the past eight years, she has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Kaklik's monthly income from this business is 150 AZN. This is a very profitable business and she is running it with her husband.
She is keeping a flock of sheep on her own property. She fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from her. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc. She requires 1900 AZN in order to purchase 12 sheep to provide more meat to sell in the autumn. She is optimistic about this loan, because in autumn more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the autumn

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. He is married, and he has two children who are students. Armen’s wife does not work. 

Armen has a higher education and a specialty as an economist. Now he is an executive director of a mineral water factory. His daughter studies at the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute.  

His son studies at Yerevan State Economical University in the first year of the faculty of Government. He studies in the paid division.

Armen asks a loan of AMD 450,000 to pay his son’s tuition fee.

loans.use: To pay his son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
La señora Mireya tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo en domicilio alquilado,  tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que dependen de ellos. Su actividad de la solicitante es la confección de diferentes prendas de vestir para niños, estudiantes, personas mayores, etc., esta actividad lo realiza  en el lugar mismo donde vive, su conyugue percibe ingresos de los trabajos de albañil.
Solicitan un crédito para la compra de  máquinas de costurar y compra de materias primas, para seguir confeccionando las diferentes prendas, ya que  ella tiene pedidos pero no tiene la suficientes máquinas para realizar de mejor manera sus trabajos y con estos ingresos con el  tiempo quieren  construir su propia casa que tanta falta le hace y de esta manera tener un techo donde vivir y realizar su actividad de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Mireya, 28, lives with her husband in a rented home.  She has three young children who are dependent on them.

Mireya's job is making different garments for children, students, adults, etc.  She does this job in the same place where she lives.  Her husband earns a living in construction.

She's requesting a loan to buy sewing machines and supplies so she can keep on making a variety of garments.  She has requests but not enough machines to do the work in the best way possible.

With this income and over time Mireya wants to build the house they need so much so she'll have her own own home and do her job better.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and supplies

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is 51 years old and a married mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. Bushra's husband has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Bushra has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his rickshaw vehicle.This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy new tires for her husband's rickshaw vehicle.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en: Sarwar is a 41-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 22 years old and married with two children between the ages of two and five. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to improve life for her and her family. 

She has been in this business since just after she got married. She sells palm oil within her community. She says that the major hardship for her business is that the cost of transportation is very high.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to take her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Meet Ruth, a farmer who hails from Kitale in South Rift, Kenya. She has been farming for four years, where she focuses on poultry and crop farming. Her source of income comes from the sale of eggs and crops. 

In farming, she appreciates the fact that she will produce more output, and that really motivates her to work harder to produce more. Poultry diseases really affect her chickens and thus destabilize the growth of her business. 

Ruth says she chose Juhudi Kilimo because they maintain good customer service with their clients. When asked what she learnt from Juhudi's required microfinance training, she said she had learned that the ability to rise from nothing to something depends on one's willingness and determination.

This loan will help her buy more poultry.  There will be an increased egg production, which means more sales for her.  This will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Rohayatin

texts.en:
Rohayatin runs a small stall selling books, pens, pencils, school accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits, and processing bill payments. Rohayatin lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area three hours from Jakarta. Rohayatin is married.

Rohayatin began working with Ruma four months ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime credits and processing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. For the last three months, she has around $2 - 5 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took a loan to get a printer from KIVA to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payment).

loans.use: To purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a farmer who lives in Kitale.  She has a farm where she does poultry, dairy, and crop farming. 

Her source of income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, and crops.  She is also involved in the transport industry by use of a motorbike. She enjoys farming because it always gives good returns, while her biggest challenge is pests and diseases affecting her crops and livestock.

Lydia said she chose Juhudi Kilimo because they have client-friendly rates on their loans. She learned that microfinances have an easier way of loan repayment.

This loan will help her purchase more poultry and hence increase her income base, which will lead to an improvement in her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 36-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a bar and runs a retail shop in order to raise money to support his family. The high cost of rent and inadequate capital are his major hindrances, while his dream is to own a modern bar that attracts executive customers. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy beer, soda, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl es un señor de 32 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel bachillerato, vive con sus dos bellas hijas de corta edad, dependientes de sus ingresos, todas las madrugadas el señor se prepara para ir a su trabajo porque ingresa a trabajar a horas 7:00 am. hasta las 15:00 pm. de lunes a sábado en una  Empresa Industrial ubicada en la comunidad de Sacaba, desde muy jovencito se dedico a trabajar en dicha empresa, con una antigüedad de 14 años de experiencia en el rubro, luego de terminar con su rutina del trabajo él se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros con su vehículo a partir de las horas 16:00 a 22:00 pm de lunes a sábado, su actividades son regulares a lo largo del año, en esta oportunidad el señor Raúl está solicitando crédito para la conclusión de la construcción de la muralla de su vivienda ya que por falta de dinero no pudo concluirlo y ahora si quiere hacerlo para brindarles mayor seguridad a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Raúl, 32, is single and has his high school diploma.  He lives with his two beautiful young daughters who depend on his income.

Raúl gets ready to go to work very early every morning because he starts at 7 a.m. and works until 3 p.m. from Monday through Saturday in an industrial business located in the Sacaba community.  He has worked for this company since he was very young and has 14 years of experience in the field.  After finishing his daily routine he provides transportation with his vehicle from 4-10 p.m. from Monday through Saturday.  His hours are regular throughout the year.

Currently Raúl's requesting a loan to finish building a wall around his house.  He didn't have the money to finish it.  He wants to do it now for the safety of his daughters.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Peruvian artisan Victor specializes in jewelry. He would like to invest in bulk purchases of silver and gemstones.

Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"Jewelry is my life. It impassions me. Each design is like a child to me. My artistic formation began when I was 12, when my older sister married an experienced silversmith. I was an apprentice at his workshop, and then became a master silversmith, too. I love the thrill of working on new designs.

"Thank you so much for offering me the opportunity of this microcredit. It means that I'll be able to decrease my production time and increase my stock, which should lead to better sales. All of this translates into making it easier to provide for my family, improve our quality of life, and ensure my children's education."

Use the following link to view Victor's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?aid=7269

loans.use: to invest in bulk purchases of silver and gemstones

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 36 years old and lives in Lchashen, a village in the Gegharkunik region. He and his wife have a farm where he breeds pigs. He has eight pigs and fifty piglets. They sell the pork to butchers and the piglets to villagers.

Hamlet also grows potatoes and has several apple and peach trees. Along with his farming and pig operation he also manages to work at a quarry.

Hamlet is applying for a loan of 700,000 AMD through Nor Horizon to buy fodder for his pigs and piglets.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his pigs and piglets.

loans.name: Yesero

texts.en:
Yesero, 45, lives in Hoima, Uganda with his wife and eight children. Supporting the family rests wholly on his shoulders.

Yesero is a farmer who mainly grows rice and ground nuts. His main challenges as a farmer are price fluctuations and unpredictable weather.

Yesero has opened a small shop and is applying for a 1,000,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell. With his profits from the shop he has been able to pay school fees for his children. His ambition is to venture into mechanized agriculture and own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has been blessed with five children, three of whom are in school and two are adults. She lives in her own house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of KSHS 50,000 to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is asking for a loan because she believes that with it, she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to save money from her charcoal business. She is requesting a loan of KSHS 40,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profit to help her family cover their personal expenses

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Don Máximo tiene 45 años de edad, su familia está compuesto de seis miembros los dos padres y cuatro hijos, es de una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos por lo tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas, vive en la comunidad de Mizque, trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria desde hace 27 años produce cebolla, papa y frejol para la alimentación de su familia y el excedente los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciante de la misma población de Mizque. Don Máximo una persona muy respetado en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos, Don Máximo está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas abonos y agroquímicos, para mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Máximo is 45 years old and his family has six members; the parents and four children. He is from a humble family of scarce economic resources, which is why he cultivates very small pieces of land. He lives in the community Mizque and has been working with agriculture and livestock for 27 years. He produces onions, potatoes, and beans for the family's own consumption and he sells the surplus to merchants in Mizque.

Máximo is a very respected person in his community because of his dedication to his work and his sense of responsibility as regards feeding and educating his children. Máximo is requesting this loan in order to buy more seeds, compost, and agrochemicals so that he can increase and improve the quality of his production, thus improving the living conditions of his whole family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and agrochemicals

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: La señorita milena es una joven muy entusiasta, tiene 21 años de edad, tiene estudios a nivel bachillerato, estudio estética en sin embargo no logro culminar los estudios por razones de recursos económico, al ser la mayor de 5 hermanos se vio obligada a trabajar en conjunto con su madre con el comercio de refrigerios y otros alimentos, con el paso de los años se independizo poco poco sin embargo requiere mayor capital para continuar con su negocio y seguir colaborando en la canasta familiar de su hogar, la necesidad de mejorar el negocio y los ingresos solicitando un crédito que le permita acceder a mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia económicamente y que sus hermanos menores logren culminar sus estudios sin dificultades, ella también pretende poder concluir sus estudios y tener  su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Milena is a very enthusiastic young woman. She is 21 years old and has a high school degree. She started studying to become a stylist, but she was not able to finish her studies because of a lack of economic resources. Being the eldest of 5 brothers and sisters, she was forced to work together with her mother in the sale of snacks and other foods.

Over the years she progressively has become independent, but she needs more capital to continue with her business and to keep helping buy the basic supplies for her home. She wants to improve her business and income by requesting a loan that will permit her to economically help her family and allow her brothers to finish their studies without difficulties. She also intends to finish her studies and to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy supplies and dishes for her business

loans.name: Gleider

texts.es:
La señora Gleider tiene 33  años de edad, vive con su hija pequeña en domicilio alquilado del Barrio la Tablada. Su principal actividad de la solicitante son trabajos de confecciona que realiza de toda clase de prendas de vestir y también arreglos en general, para ambos sexos y diferentes instituciones y personas, esta actividad lo realiza en el mismo domicilio donde vive.
Gleider solicita crédito para la compra de una máquina, para así seguir fabricando diferentes  prendas de vestir y de esta manera  con estos ingresos poder adquirir un lote de terreno y poder construir su propia vivienda y tener su taller de costura de una mejor manera, para si no tener que cambiarse de ubicación cada vez ya que los alquileres son caros e incrementan constantemente.
texts.en:
Gleider is 33 years old and lives with her young daughter in a rented home in the Tablada neighborhood. She works as a seamstress, making and mending all kinds of clothing items, for both men and women and different institutions and people. She does this work from her home. 

Gleider is asking for this loan to buy a sewing machine. This machine will help her increase production and in this way earn the income she needs to acquire a plot of land where she will construct her own home and have her sewing room. She hopes this will help her run her businesses better, so she does not have to change location every time her rent is up since they keep increasing the price.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz con su esposa y su hijo, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos economices y por la necesidad de trabajar, Carlos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Carlos trabaja en su pequeño de venta de ropa, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir para abastecer su negocio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 43-year-old man who lives in the city of Huaraz, in the Carhuaz district, together with his wife and son. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, dedicating all his efforts to helping his family move up. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the need to work, Carlos couldn't do  a professional degree. Of his own initiative, Carlos works in his small clothing store. He works every day, about 10 hours, and thinks that it is going well for him due to his dedication and effort. 

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as it is thanks to the help they offer that he will be able to buy a larger quantity and variety of clothing to stock his business. So he will continue working and putting in effort to achieve his great dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 31 years old. He is married and has one child. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys used the previous loan to buy produce to sell. She is a 37-year-old married woman, with two children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Gladys has been running a produce business to earn additional income and supplement her work as a small scale farmer for six years. 

She wishes to construct a permanent house, which she has already started building, and educate her children so that they can, at a minimum, attain degrees. She supplies produce to schools on credit and faces hardships due to their delayed payments. Her goal is to own a food store that can sustainably supply her customers year-round. 

Gladys intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Fatmata, from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with three children.  

For the past 20 years, Fatmata has run her ground-nut business alongside her palm-oil business at her house. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well because out of the profit, it enables her to take care of her family.

Fatmata requires a loan to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business.

In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has four children. In 2003, Ramatu established her wood business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to buy more wood to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Ramatu plans to change her business to a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wood to expand her business

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in handcrafted, jade-and-silver jewelry. He would like to invest in materials, such as jade and sterling silver, for his work.

Rafael has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"I have a great love for jewelry; this is my vocation. In the 1980s, my father learned to create designs with jade. With the passing years, he came to craft very good jewelry. When I was 12, I began helping in the workshop after school and, little by little, I learned the art. I hope to be able to sell my own designs so that my father's dream of having a large workshop can come true. I dream that my wife and I can go to college one day and work hard, so that we can give our children everything they need."

"I'm very grateful for this opportunity, because it's a huge help to me and a way for us to get ahead. Often, we have to stop production when we run out of materials. This microcredit will let me buy a bit of silver and jade and develop new designs. I thank all of you very much for your assistance and for understanding an artisan's needs."

Use the link below to view Rafael's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/9013

loans.use: to invest in materials for his work, such as jade and sterling silver

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Doña María Isabel es una mujer casada que se dedica a la agricultura, luchadora y emprendedora de 38 años de edad con una familia conformada por 2 hijos los cuales viven en su casa junto a ella. Su esposo se encuentra en EE.UU el cual ayuda con remesas a su familia para que puedan cubrir otros gastos que son necesarios en el hogar. En compañía de sus hijos ha logrado echar a andar sus cultivos de café pudiendo asistirlos con las medidas necesarias y con el sumo cuidado y protección para que la cosecha sea provechosa. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 100 metros de su casa de habitación al cual en compañía de sus hijos se traslada caminando diariamente para poder asistirlos.
Actualmente han emprendido un proyecto el cual conlleva al mejoramiento de su cultivo y están solicitando ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, bombas de fumigación para que esta nueva producción sea más rentable y mejor aprovechada para su venta. 
Sus metas y sueños son los de poder ampliar sus cultivos de café logrando comprar más tierra y cultivarla con una variedad diferente como el caturra, el nance entre otras variedades que son factibles de cultivar ya que la tierra es muy fértil.
texts.en:
Doña María Isabel is married and works in agriculture, she is a hard worker and enterprising at 38 years old. She has 2 children who live at home with her. Her husband is working in the United States and sends money back to his family to cover household expenses. With her children at her side, she has been able to improve her coffee production, being able to get her crops all they need and to also care and protect her plants in order to have a productive harvest. Her fields are located a mere 100 meters from her home where she walks with her children to care for them. 
She is currently developing a project that would help her to improve her harvests and to do so, she is asking for fertilizers, manure and fumigation bombs so that her crops are more easily sold and she can truly take advantage of their sale. 
Her hopes and dreams are to be able to expand her cultivation, to have more land and to be able to grow a different variety of coffee bean, a variety that is easy to grow because her land is very fertile.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, manure and fumigation for her crops.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana has already experienced the benefits of KIVA lending services. A previous loan has helped her to sustain her business and increase her immediate income. 
This time Oksana is hoping to receive 10 000 Grivnas to purchase sugar, flour, noodles, oil and cereal at a local wholesale warehouse for further retail sale at her vending location. Stocking her business with additional merchandise, she is hoping to increase her income even more.

loans.use: to stock up on flour, sugar, spaghetti and other food products

loans.name: Erica Anataly

texts.es:
Erika tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en Morropon donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú, que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la comercialización de fruta , Erika es una mujer emprendedora, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para capital de trabajo con la finalidad de invertirlo en la compra de frutas de estación para posteriormente ofrecerlo en las juguerías de la zona y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Erika is 25 years old and lives with her family in Morropon, whose inhabitants work in agriculture and trading small livestock. The city is located about two hours from the city of Piura, in the Region of the same name. The Piura Region is on the northern coast of Peru, which is characterized by a hot climate.

For the past three years she has worked in the fruit trade. Erika is a self-starting woman and has requested a loan of 500 PEN as working capital, with the intent of investing it in the purchase of seasonal fruits. She will then be able to offer them to local juice stores and in this way make a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Russvey Jonathan

texts.es:
Russvey es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Russvey no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Russvey trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos medicinales naturistas, adicionalmente trabaja como chófer de mototaxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Russvey se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar mayor variedad de medicina natural para surtir su negocio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Russvey is a 22-year-old man, single and lives in the city of Pucallpa. He is very hard-working, enthusiastic and strives to get ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack if economic resources and because of the need to work, Russvey was not able to get a professional degree.

By his own initiative, Russvey works in a small business selling natural medicinal products. He also works as a motorcycle taxi driver, providing transportation services in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and he believes he is doing well because of his dedication and the efforts he makes.

Russvey is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they bring him, he will be able to buy a larger variety of natural medicines to supply his business, and so he will keep working and making an effort to achieve his dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise
